Overview
Astrophe Enterprises and its subsidiaries (“AE”) embody the resolution that all life can continually be improved for the benefit of all living beings. AE strives to achieve this ideal through engineering organizations for positive change. Driving maximum impact through innovation.

We are currently hiring Software Developers of various levels of experience to join our team of innovators and builders that are helping businesses and organizations grow without sacrificing their ideals or vision. To that end, Astrophe team members must embody our values integrity, resilience, diversity, creativity, and passion.

Astrophe fosters a collaborative and fast-paced environment, and there is tremendous opportunities for growth within our organization for smart, reliable, hard-working individuals. 

Responsibilities
Results-focused software development
• Follow the Astrophe Enterprises Development Principles
• Drive progress on 1-3 concurrent projects
• Own the development lifecycle
• Rapid bug response in rare emergency situations
• Weekly check-ins with concise and useful updates
• Track your time accurately
• Support the development of an Astrophe Product (optional)

Key Requirements
• A strong interest in learning, entrepreneurship, and software development
• Full stack developers preferred; framework agnostic
• Strong communication skills
• Self-motivated and detail-oriented
• BS in Computer Science, Math, or Physics in progress or completed (preferred)

What you'll be doing

Push code, own architectural decisions for an engineering team deploying daily across consumer-facing, therapist-facing, and internal-facing platforms; back-end web services. Our back-end is node, our front-end is react.

Work with both technical cofounders to build an engineering team as it grows from three to ten over the next year.

Work alongside the cofounders to help set the development roadmap and bring to market novel technology solutions to America’s mental health epidemic.

Grow and learn by doing. You’ll contribute to any part of the business that interests you. Interested in product management? Great -- work with us to conduct user research and build out our roadmap. Want to learn about user acquisition? Awesome -- help implement our SEO strategy.

Change the trajectory of a startup striving to redefine access to mental health in America.

What we're looking for

You’ve architected and coded back-end services; 

Ideally, you've also have Front-End chops (even more ideally, you've shipped code in React or another single-page JS framework).

You've built things from the ground-up, and you work well with teams.

(preferred) BS, MS in Computer Science or related field.

(preferred) Experience in product, design, or other position complementary to software engineering.

You will ensure that these components and the overall application are robust and easy to maintain. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is an asset.

•         Analyze, diagnose and resolve errors related to applications

We have two internship opportunities with our Tucson-based startup, Inara.

The Software Developer helps with the development of our current project, a Streaming Ebooks Micropayments platform and mobile web application using a SDK based on the Hedera distributed ledger network and consensus algorithm. The duties primarily revolve around building software by writing code, as well as modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware, improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces. The Software Developer will be involved in directing system testing and validation procedures, and also working with customers and Management Team on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.

• Designing and developing software systems using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcomes and design consequences.
• Modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware, improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces.
• Directing system testing and validation procedures.
• Directing software programming and documentation development.
• Consulting with Management Team and Customer Advisory Board on project status and proposals.
• Working Management Team and Customer Advisory Board on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.
• Analyzing information to recommend and plan the installation of new systems and modifications of an existing system.
• Consulting with Product Manager to evaluate software-hardware interfaces and develop specifications and performance requirements.
• Preparing reports on programming project specifications, activities, or status.
• Conferring with Product Manager to obtain information on limitations or capabilities.

Must be authorized to work in U.S. 

We are committed to providing a superior internship experience including an engineering and other hands-on training. Our commitment extends to working with our interns in their career development. We tie the internship to our interns' formal education program whenever possible. 

If this all sounds like you, contact us today and let’s talk about creating a new future. 

About Inara
Inara is a tokenized ebooks economy that enables authors to get paid directly for every page stream of their ebooks and for readers to participate in ebooks curation with an incentivized design. When the page turns, the author earns.

Inara CEO Glenn McCreedy founded Breakaway Media LLC—among the first publishing companies in 2009 to publish and sell on Amazon’s Kindle Direct Publishing platform. We sold nearly a million ebooks over the years and our title, THE SHOP, bumped The Hunger Games off Amazon’s number one spot.

We realized that we and other authors in our network were increasingly challenged to earn a living with Amazon’s tightening algorithms, thousands of authors joining the platform every month, and the downward pricing pressure on ebooks all the way to “free.” Now, authors are forced to buy ads from Amazon to get visibility and sell on KDP. We founded Inara and built an ebook ecommerce platform to help authors break free and get paid directly so they can earn a living and write the great books that readers want to read. 

Today, Inara is a proud cohort member of the Hedera Boost startup program — hedera.com/boost. We are building on the success of our existing platform and designing a new category, Streaming Ebooks Micropayments that is transforming the publishing industry. 

At Inara, you will always have your best opportunity to contribute and develop yourself. We have fun and strive to lift each other up. We prize initiative and creativity and believe that each member of the team is a leader serving others.

Role and Responsibilities of the Position:

The Summer Intern assists with development of our current project, a Streaming Ebooks Micropayments platform and mobile web application using a SDK based on the Hedera distributed ledger network and Consensus Algorithm. The Inara core hypothesis will be tested with the Minimum Viable Product developed by the Inara dev team. The duties primarily revolve around building software by writing code, as well as modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware, improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces. The Summer Intern will be involved in conducting system testing and validation procedures, and also working with customers and Management Team on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.

• Designing and developing software systems using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcomes and design consequences.
• Modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware, improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces.
• Conducting system testing and validation procedures.
• Conducting software programming and documentation development.
• Consulting with Management Team, Hedera Team, and Customer Advisory Board on project status and proposals.
• Working Management Team and Customer Advisory Board on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.
• Analyzing information to recommend and plan the installation of new systems and modifications of an existing system.
• Consulting with Product Manager to evaluate software-hardware interfaces and develop specifications and performance requirements.
• Preparing reports on programming project specifications, activities, or status.
• Conferring with Product Manager to obtain information on limitations or capabilities.

We are interested in interns with the following experience and skills: 

Front-End React development and/or development with other front-end frameworks. Mobile Web development. UX/UI design. Prototyping/Wireframing. RESTful APIs design. Use of databases: relational and non-relational. Use of Cloud services.

React.js, ReactNative, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Node.js, Python, Ruby on Rails, C++, JavaScript, Figma, Adobe XD, Invision.

Experience with back-end frameworks such as Flask and Django preferred. 

Familiarity with Hedera Hashgraph (hedera.com) and/or blockchain and cryptocurrency, a plus. 

Work from your remote location. 

Nature of the Internship:

This is an unpaid internship position. 

(1) The training in the field of Computer Science is similar to and enhances instruction given in studies at institutions of higher learning.
(2) The internship is for your benefit to receive training and mentoring, and to provide valuable experience for future job selection, application, and performance in the field of Computer Science.
(3) You will work under the close observation of mentors at the Company.
(4) Unless advised otherwise, interns are not entitled to a job at the conclusion of the internship period.
(5) You are not entitled to wages or other compensation other than your experience and learning for the time spent as an intern for the Company.
(6) The internship does not create an "employment" relationship under the Fair Labor Standards Act ("FLSA") or any other definition, and the FLSA's minimum wage and overtime provisions do not apply.

Start Date:  Immediately
End Date: August 31, 2020
Number of hours per week: 20

Databases are the beating heart of every business in the world.
Cockroach Labs is the team behind CockroachDB, an open source, distributed SQL database. We strive to build infrastructure that keeps pace with the world, so developers can focus on what matters most: building the best products. Come and join us on our mission to Make Data Easy. Are you ready to aim high and build to last?
The Role
We are looking for extraordinary Backend, Full-stack, and Frontend Engineering Interns to join our team.


Design, code, and test the web frontend for CockroachCloud or the backend for our distributed, open source database, CockroachDB. You will bring your expertise to the table to provide the best user experience to our users, partners, and customers.
You will collaborate with web designers, product managers, and customers to create user friendly experience to deploy, manage, monitor CockroachDB.
A huge bonus is that even after your experience at Cockroach Labs ends, your code will live on in our open source GitHub repo, CockroachDB. Come help us on our mission to Make Data Easy!
### The Expectations


In your first 30 days, you will become an integrated member of our engineering team. During this time, you will work on a starter project that allows you to gain confidence in navigating the code base and gain familiarity with our engineering environment. We believe that it's important for you to take this first month to become familiar with our technology and our company. 

For the next 3 months, you will contribute to our codebase for CockroachDB, CockroachCloud, or our developer infrastructure. After wrapping up your starter project, you will work with your manager to focus your efforts on a project that aligns with your interests and the product roadmap.
You

You are pursuing or have recently completed studies in Computer Science or a related technical field, graduating between May 2021 and May 2023.
You have had exposure to coursework on subjects like distributed systems, concurrency control, data replication, file systems, or SQL processing.
Comfort using programming languages like Javascript, React, Redux, Go, C/C++, Java, and Python/Django. We use React.js, Redux, and Typescript on the client side and use Go on the server side. If you don't know any of these languages, you'll learn them while you're here.
You love building relationships with your colleagues. You enjoy being part of the code review process and partnering with your teammates on challenging problems.
You have past experience working on production-level code.
You are genuinely interested in Cockroach Labs' mission and are excited to use CockroachDB in your projects.

Databases are the beating heart of every business in the world.
Cockroach Labs is the team behind CockroachDB, an open source, distributed SQL database. We strive to build infrastructure that keeps pace with the world, so developers can focus on what matters most: building the best products. Come and join us on our mission to Make Data Easy. Are you ready to aim high and build to last?
The Role
We are looking for extraordinary Backend, Full-stack, and Frontend Engineering Interns to join our team.


Design, code, and test the web frontend for CockroachCloud or the backend for our distributed, open source database, CockroachDB. You will bring your expertise to the table to provide the best user experience to our users, partners, and customers.
You will collaborate with web designers, product managers, and customers to create user friendly experience to deploy, manage, monitor CockroachDB.
A huge bonus is that even after your experience at Cockroach Labs ends, your code will live on in our open source GitHub repo, CockroachDB. Come help us on our mission to Make Data Easy!
### The Expectations


In your first 30 days, you will become an integrated member of our engineering team. During this time, you will work on a starter project that allows you to gain confidence in navigating the code base and gain familiarity with our engineering environment. We believe that it's important for you to take this first month to become familiar with our technology and our company. 

For the next 3 months, you will contribute to our codebase for CockroachDB, CockroachCloud, or our developer infrastructure. After wrapping up your starter project, you will work with your manager to focus your efforts on a project that aligns with your interests and the product roadmap.
You

You are pursuing or have recently completed studies in Computer Science or a related technical field, graduating between May 2021 and May 2023.
You have had exposure to coursework on subjects like distributed systems, concurrency control, data replication, file systems, or SQL processing.
Comfort using programming languages like Javascript, React, Redux, Go, C/C++, Java, and Python/Django. We use React.js, Redux, and Typescript on the client side and use Go on the server side. If you don't know any of these languages, you'll learn them while you're here.
You love building relationships with your colleagues. You enjoy being part of the code review process and partnering with your teammates on challenging problems.
You have past experience working on production-level code.
You are genuinely interested in Cockroach Labs' mission and are excited to use CockroachDB in your projects.


Our interview process consists largely of programming in a real environment, and we'll be evaluating you on the skills listed above.

Cockroach Labs is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you need additional accommodations to feel comfortable during your interview process, please email us at accessibility@cockroachlabs.com.

At BGPC, a non-profit company, you will be tasked with learning about technologies we use to develop a platform which will enable entrepreneurs to create projects and use profits to fund humanitarian efforts. With knowledge of design patterns we use, you will be able to design and implement architecture, user-facing components and backend business logic to help us achieve our mission.

We are a small group of volunteer developers looking to launch an alpha version of our platform before the summer ends. Our goal is to use the platform ourselves and gradually expand it to be publicly available.

You will gain a lot of experience in modern web development, focusing on commonly used (and powerful) technologies: TypeScript, AWS, React, Jest and others. Our goal is to collaborate on developing the platform and help each other increase our value as developers.

The platform itself is responsible for facilitating management of "capital-building" projects, funding humanitarian projects, moderating user transactions, providing ways to spend and receive money in a completely programmable way and automating contractual relationships between the company, project managers, workers and contractors.

We operate in a monorepo setup, using commonly shared design patterns which help us accelerate development and reduce the amount of bugs we have to fix.

We use a test-first approach, littered with best practices, and you will be required to adopt our patterns in order to facilitate scaling development and production workloads.

What is OffWeGo? 

There are a million ways to have fun, but only a few ways to be safe. At OffWeGo we supply universities and study abroad providers with a central platform to keep track of and secure their students’ travels, helping to protect their duty of care, while providing students with better experiences and long lasting friendships. Our mission  is to transform needed security behaviors from “have to” to “want to," by applying social interaction, comparison, and gamification principles.

*Remote OK
*
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Are you a current undergrad/grad student or recent grad? Are you looking to get some work experience under your belt? Come work for OffWeGo! We understand that there’s a catch-22 when it comes to being a junior developer. You need to have the experience to get the entry level job, but you need the entry-level job to get experience! Skills can be taught, but attitude is what makes someone a good, long-term fit at the position. 

We ask our junior developers to have the following characteristics:


You need to be a great learner. This, hands down, is the most important thing you can bring to the table. You will need to be willing to work hard to learn what you don’t know.
You need to be comfortable with the unknown. You’ll be doing things that you have never done before. All day, every day. If that’s exciting to you, this is the right fit!
You should be comfortable with the fundamentals of programming. You will be writing real, production code in your first week on the job. So, you should be familiar with the basics of one or two programming languages. You should have opinions about the “right” way to build things. You don’t need to know the “best” way of doing everything.


Responsibilities


Writing and modifying front and back-end code  of company website, primarily using Python (Django Framework), JavaScript (VueJS, React, and React Native Frameworks), AWS, PostgreSQL
Assist with API technical documentation
Developing new feature pages using existing components
Creating intuitive responsive websites & web apps
Produce “clean” and well-structured code, with detailed specifications
Collaborate with the team in all phases of the development lifecycle
Troubleshooting complex queries and performance issues in the development process
Assist with designing and implementing new features to facilitate related procedures and tools
Performing quality assurance testing and participating in code reviews
Troubleshoot, test and maintain the core product software and databases to ensure strong optimization and functionality


Requirements


Able to write clean, readable code and perform basic tests
Proficient in: Python (Django Framework), JavaScript (VueJS, React, and React Native Frameworks), PostgreSQL
Experience integrating with third-party APIs
Committed to dedicating minimum of 10-15 hours a week on projects
Enjoys working in a fast-paced, startup environment
Strong communication skills, deriving technical requirements from non-technical sources
Self-motivated
Understand the fundamentals of user-centered design
Preferred
A keen interest in higher education and ed-tech
Passion for off-campus studies/international education/study abroad
Basic experience with AWS and/or cloud computing


By the end of the internship The Intern will:


Gain hands-on entrepreneurial experience with a start-up in Washington DC
Experience the practical challenges of working in a start-up environment
Learn how to leverage their academic strengths and personality, and network to add value OffWeGo
Have a well-rounded view of the pros and cons of working in a start-up environment
Have an understanding of the structure of the industry that OffWeGo is operating in, its competitive landscape, and changing dynamics
Have gained experience working in a start-up environment characterized by fluid job descriptions, changing priorities, flat hierarchies, and high requirements on flexibility and engagement
Have gained experience with the difficulties in managing time and expectations, negotiating tradeoffs, and prioritizing tasks in an ever-changing environment
Be able to reflect on their personal and professional abilities


This is an unpaid position, depending on institution and requirements, college credit will be awarded.

Please no external agency requests
    Must be authorized to work in US

OffWeGo is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. OffWeGo does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, sex, color, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, mental or physical disability, genetic information, veteran status, or on any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Epoch Games is a volunteer based, all-online, global game development team (we have no centrally-located headquarters). Most of the original founding members were modders developing the total conversion Middle Earth Roleplaying Project (MERP) mod for the Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim:
http://www.moddb.com/mods/merp-middle-earth-roleplaying-project

Currently Epoch Games is developing Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). LoA:SO is an in-development indie open-world RPG set in an original fantasy world. The game is being developed using Epic Games' Unreal Engine 4 (UE4):
https://www.unrealengine.com/

For more information about the game, please check out our IndieDb page:
http://www.indiedb.com/games/the-lays-of-althas-sundered-order

JOB DESCRIPTION

In this volunteer position you will be working closely with other members of the Coding department to develop C++ code for the Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). Keep in mind that we are using Epic Game’s Unreal Engine 4 (UE4) to develop the game, and knowledge of how C++ code interacts with UE4 is required. Knowledge of Blueprint scripting in UE4 is recommended, but not required.

Communication is key to a smooth and efficient pipeline, you must be able to communicate clearly and effectively with other team-members and not be afraid to ask should any problems arise. We are an English-speaking team, so English fluency is a must.

If you are comfortable with teaching, you may be called upon to aid the more junior members of the team in any relevant area.

Other duties include: attending Slack meetings (Slack is an instant messaging we communicate with); completing monthly reports; and following team policies.

This is a volunteer position, so no monetary compensation is being offered.

At this time, we are having to rely upon free (or previously licensed) software. Please refer to the applications listed below for guidelines. We do not endorse piracy.

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum Skill Requirements:


  C++ programming experience.
  Unreal Engine 4 and how C++ code interacts with it
  Providing clear and legible code.
  Online communication and Team-collaboration skills.
  A passion for coding and a dedication to creating AAA quality games.
  At least 1 Unreal Engine project (using C++) prepared to show prior to the interview.


Optional Skill Requirements:


  Blueprint scripting experience


SOFTWARE REQUIREMENTS

Required Software:


  Unreal Engine 4 (https://www.unrealengine.com/register)


Recommended Software:


  GitHub (https://www.unrealengine.com/ue4-on-github)
  GitLab (what we use for version control of our project)
  Eclipse IDE for C++ (http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/packages/eclipse-ide-cc-developers/lunasr1), Visual Studio Community 2017 (https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/downloads/), and/or Notepad++ (http://www.notepad-plus-plus.org/download/v6.6.6.html)

location: New York City • San Francisco • Brooklyn • Remote
description:
At ListAcross we're building a growing team of innovators going after a huge market by putting the user at the center. We're creating a company built on technology, design, and data, so our users can take their sales to the next level. Our platform enables retailers and sellers on P2P marketplaces (Craigslist, Facebook Marketplace, OfferUp, Craigslist, eBay, etc.) to "level up" with a suite of tools that lets them sell anything, everywhere. Our channel manager allows seamless cross-posting, renewals, and de-listing, and our inventory management and communications tools help sellers increase revenue and maximize sale velocity.

We have been accepted to a prestigious accelerator and are currently focusing on an aggressive development cycle, so we can beta test/ship our product and bring it to market in the coming weeks,.

We have an immediate opening for a front-end development intern to translate UX/UI wireframes into functional code for the various pages on our developing platform. The ideal candidate should be a passionate coder and developer, a self-starter, efficient in both autonomous and collaborative environments, and be receptive to feedback. Personal accountability, accountability to the team, and ability to work effectively under deadlines are essential.

We are open to both students and professionals (If you are an experienced professional that has been furloughed or laid off due to coronavirus and want to ensure continuity on your resume and LinkedIn profile, or if you're looking to boost your portfolio, @ us!).

We are happy to consider remote candidates (our entire team is currently remote due to Covid-19), and while this internship is unpaid, we are happy to work with you and your academic institution to ensure that you receive academic credit, where applicable.

Responsibilities:
• Translation of UI/UX design into effective and functional code
• Use of markup languages such as HTML to create user-friendly web pages
• Collaboration with lead backend developer to ensure (and improve) usability
• Application optimization for maximum speed
• Creation of reusable and reliable code and libraries for future use

Qualifications:
• Experience with JavaScript, CSS, node.js, React.js, and jQuery
• Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks (including jQuery)
• Strong proficiency with HTML, CSS

Job Type: Internship, 3-6 months, with possibility to renew
Internship Compensation: College Credit, Unpaid
Schedule: Monday to Friday (Flexible)

Please include a brief cover note (a sentence or two is fine) letting us know why you're interested in ListAcross, and please include a link to relevant work/your portfolio and LinkedIn profile.

No recruiters
Please keep all communication and applications on Angel.co
Please do not reach out via LinkedIn

During your internship at Prune, you will get the chance to tackle challenging problems including: iterate quickly on a consumer-facing app; make architecture decisions with lasting impact; work with scientists to implement the latest ML algorithms in image recognition, NLP, and recommendation engines.

Previous internship experience or completed projects and coursework using CS fundamentals.

How To Apply 
This is a paid internship/part-time role that cycles throughout the year. Applications are welcome at any time of the year.

Prune.ai presents a scientific approach to social media marketing. We are building an AI-powered marketplace to help businesses promote their products via word-of-mouth on social media. We have a MVP in stealth mode and are currently testing via closed beta.

The engineering team works directly with Machine Learning Scientists, so there is opportunity for significant technical learning. Our team includes a PhD, ex-Amazon, and people with 10+ years of experience. Our team of 5 is fully remote at the moment, but we'd prefer applicants from the US to maximize time-zone overlap.

Responsibilities:


Form a deep understanding of our users by interacting with them
A/B test various versions of our product, with statistical analysis of quantitative results
Work with UX researcher to design and prioritize new features for the product based on qualitative beta tests and quantitative A/B tests
Run marketing experiments and tweak marketing copy/messaging/design based on customer feedback
Basic front end development (coding), mostly html/css/javascript, working alongside front end developers

Currently enrolled as a full-time sophomore or junior student in a technical field.
The right instincts for launching technology products, proven by prior experience and whiteboard exercises
Experience writing software in a programming language such as Python
Desire to learn quickly
Demonstrated capacity to communicate complex concepts clearly and simply 


How To Apply 
This is a paid internship/part-time role that cycles throughout the year. Applications are welcome at any time of the year.

As a Zoox Sensor Systems Intern, you should be self-driven, organized, and comfortable working in a cross-functional role. We're looking for a student who has industry experience with systems engineering, and is familiar with different sensing modalities.

This role can be done remotely, but depending on the start and end dates of the internship, we will welcome interns to our campus if it is safe to do so. Zoox is taking all precautions necessary and complying with regulations to ensure the safety of our employees in the midst of the pandemic.

Qualifications


Currently working towards a degree in a relevant engineering program and within 1 year of graduation
Minimum of a 3.5 gpa
At least one previous industry internship or co-op
Able to commit to a minimum of a 12-week internship
Professional and positive communication skills
Interns at Zoox may not use any proprietary information they are working on as part of their thesis, any published work with their university, or to be distributed to anyone outside of Zoox.


Technical Qualifications


Familiarity with the Systems Engineering V-Model
Familiarity with technical requirements definition and verification & validation methods
Experience with MATLAB and Python
Experience building dashboards and/or generating actionable reports
Knowledge of sensors and sensing technology (automotive or otherwise)


Responsibilities (including but not limited to)


Work with sensor module and perception engineers to analyze sensor performance, through analysis of real-world driving logs and structured tests
Develop tools to visualize sensor coverage in 2D and 3D, and validate against requirements
Responsible for ensuring the quality of requirements traceability, from vehicle level down to sensor module
Develop tools for tracking/reporting metrics on requirements quality and completeness
Create training materials and collaborate with sensor module groups to ensure consistency across the team and iterate on requirements where needed
Review design validation test cases and establish links to requirements
Identify disconnects and gaps for process and workflow improvement


ABOUT ZOOX

Zoox is developing the first ground-up, fully autonomous vehicle fleet and the supporting ecosystem required to bring this technology to market. Sitting at the intersection of artificial intelligence, robotics, and design, Zoox aims to provide the next generation of mobility-as-a-service in urban environments. We’re looking for top talent that shares our passion and wants to be part of a fast-moving and highly execution-oriented team.

Follow us on LinkedIn

A Final Note:
You do not need to match every listed expectation to apply for this position. Here at Zoox, we know that diverse perspectives foster the innovation we need to be successful, and we are committed to building a team that encompasses a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and skills.

At Seven Eight Capital, research is about working with the smartest quants on Wall Street to generate exceptional returns. Seven Eight is built around hiring the best team and enabling them to reach their full potential.  Our quantitative developers are at the core of what we do, enabling research to scale and putting to work the newest software engineering developments.

About Us

Banyan Infrastructure combines financial and technological innovation to accelerate the deployment of solar, wind and other critical infrastructure around the globe. We use blockchain-based, smart contract technology to oversee and automate the complex and time consuming contractual compliance of renewable energy loans. Our platform enables lenders and borrowers to synthesize key insights and proactively mitigate risk with greater transparency across all counter parties, from origination to syndication.

About You

First and foremost, you have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You are also an energetic self-starter who shows personal initiative. In addition, you have or are interested in:
-- Strong analytical, troubleshooting and problem skills
-- Working knowledge of basic UNIX environments
-- Experience or knowledge of basic SQL
-- Experience in programming languages. Python or Java.
-- Experience working with functional programming

About The Role

We are looking for an intern that is undertaking a degree in Computer Science or study in a similar area. The intern will work with the product and engineering team at Banyan Infrastructure. This team is responsible for engineering and building our core product.

The Internship Will Be In Two Areas

Operations: The intern will work within a team deploying new software to our new and upcoming customers. The work will include change management procedures, automated and manual deployments and troubleshooting of technical issues. The role includes solving production issues in SaaS environments, working with the Banyan product team.

Engineering: The intern will undertake a project to develop one ore more features used within the Banyan core platform to enable lenders to more efficiently invest and enable renewable infrastructure.

What You will Receive

This is an unpaid position but you will receive standard perks while working, and you will get full exposure to the early days of startup life and challenges. You will walk away with incredible contacts in a blooming technical space, a rich item for your resume, and experience working with the Banyan engineering team which will make you a better software engineer forever. Banyan will also provide ongoing direct mentorship, professional references, and as you grow and we grow. potential FT positions in the future.

We look forward to hearing from you.

WellThee is a cutting-edge mobile application that is improving people's wellness and cardiovascular health, and we’re looking for great people to help us develop it. 

We are currently seeking a Backend Engineering Intern to join our development team.  Our summer internship program runs from September 8 - December 11, 2020.  As a Backend Engineering Intern, you will work on backend development tasks.  Specific assignments will vary depending upon your interests and skills.

This is an excellent opportunity to participate in an exciting, emerging startup at an early stage; learn from a fun, friendly and highly-motivated team of developers; gain valuable work experience; and enhance your resume for future opportunities.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Your responsibilities will be to:

• Work with WellThee backend engineers on innovative web applications
• Research, test and contribute to the adoption of software architecture, programming languages and new technologies
• Write, test and document code, and ensure code quality, reliability and optimal performance

QUALIFICATIONS

• Recent Sofware Engineering Bootcamp graduate OR full-time undergraduate or graduate student in Computer Science or related field at an accredited college or university
• 3.0 GPA or higher
• Proficiency in and experience with backend end programming languages, specifically Node.js, Postgres SQL databases and AWS
• Interest in developing scalable, adaptive, high-performance apps
• Ability to write and test high-quality, readable, reliable and well-architected code
• Ability to define, understand, develop, test and iterate new product features
• Experience with markup languages
• Familiarity with Git version control
• Located in or willing to work in New York City
• Strong written and verbal communication skills

BONUS SKILLS & QUALITIES

• Deep interest in software development and knowledge of latest technological developments
• Knowledge of backend development using React.js or Swift
• Interest in startups

The Backend Engineering Intern position is an unpaid role, and the intern is not considered an employee for wage purposes and shall not receive employee benefits, such as health or dental insurance, or pension or retirement credit.  Participation in the internship does not guarantee the intern a job at the conclusion of the internship.

Applicants who receive college/university credit for internships are strongly encouraged to apply.  And WellThee is happy to work with your educational institution to help you earn credit for your internship.

Company Description:
mobUX is at the forefront of mobile marketing. A Martech startup that creates interactive mobile touch points for brands to connect to consumers and drive action. 

We exist because websites are outdated and ineffective and apps require too much buy-in from consumers. We are an agile marketing solution that delivers the user experience of an app without the long lead-times, heavy development costs, and friction to download one.

Founder Bio:
Martin is a management consultant turned startup employee turned startup founder. He founded mobUX when he found a lot of friction in the mobile marketing space between what brands are putting out there and what consumers want and need to engage. This obsession combined with capitalizing on converging trends of mobile, web-apps, and what is currently offered, mobUX (Mobile User Experience) was born.

Looking for:
Look for an enthusiastic candidate about mobile marketing tech. The part-time intern role will work directly with the Founder to assist with all the company’s technical needs. Yup is a system for determining the agreed-upon social value of anything on the Internet, from  Tweets and YouTube videos to blogs and news articles. It provides stronger incentives for giving meaningful opinions online by allowing users to earn money and influence if their opinion is supported by other influential members of the community. When users rate content, people, or products they have both their reputation and potential income at stake, which results in better incentives for judging content meaningfully. Our goal is to create a universal, disintermediated layer of social consensus, where the agreed-upon social value of anything online can be determined without reliance on centralized platforms like YouTube or Twitter

We're developing a mechatronic device to help the personal care products retail industry deal with some of the challenges that Covid has brought to the industry, and we're looking a mechatronics intern to assist in bringing the device from a prototype to a consumer ready product to be launched in Fall 2020.

The device combines a tablet as the UI, an Arduino as the microcontroller (firmware is written in C), a plastic internal structure fabricated using a 3D printer, and a few standard mechanical components. 

As part of the internship, you will be involved in 1) making changes to the device's design in CAD, 2) fabricating (or finding a supplier to fabricate) the device's internal and external structure, 3) maintaining the machine’s electronics system, 4) ensuring that the communication between the server and Arduino is stable, as well as other things that pop up in finishing the product.

We’re looking for someone who has a mechatronics skill set (including CAD, PCB design, Arduino, 3D printing, motors, etc…), is detail oriented, a self starter, and is interested in building beautiful consumer facing products.

The role will be 15 – 25 hours/week for the Fall semester, and will be unpaid. It will also be mostly remote, though there will be some need to work with other engineers wherever the prototype is located in the NYC area (given Covid, we'll have to figure out how to do that safely).

Ideally, if the internship goes well from both our sides, we would like bring on the candidate in a part time equity position after the internship ends (and if the company grows we’d love for it to turn into a full time position), but if you are just interested in a Fall internship and not necessarily joining the company, that’s fine too!

We're a stealth mode startup developing a hardware/software solution to address the challenges that the personal care industry is facing as a result of Covid 19.

We've developed a V1 prototype of our product, and are looking for a software engineering intern to finish the product's software development to be launched in Fall 2020.

The product works in two ways. It accepts orders from a web app on the tablet of our product, or it can accept orders by scanning a QR code on the tablet and using the web app that pops up on your phone to place the order. We fulfill customers orders by having the web app communicate directly with an arduino, so this type of experience would be a major plus.

The role's responsibiltiies are as follows: 


Build product's software component
Integrate software into overall hardware product 


Desired skills:


Experience with NodeJS
Experience with ReactJS 
Experience integrating payment processor into app
IoT integration
Full stack web app development (design is really simple)
API dev


The internship is unpaid, will last around 2 months, and will require around 15-20 hours work/week. Ideally, if the internship goes well from both our sides, we would like bring on the candidate in a part time equity position after the internship ends (and if the company grows we’d love for it to turn into a full time position), but if you are just interested in an internship and not necessarily joining the company, that’s fine too.

location: New York City • San Francisco • Colorado • Remote
description:
Are you tired of boring fintech apps? Are you interested in cryptocurrency? Do you want to learn more about the role it plays in the new economy and how to leverage that to your advantage? Apollo is creating the future of crypto trading and spearheading cryptoasset adoption by taking a user-first approach. We want to create a delightful user experience and a performant platform that makes users come back for more! We welcome passionate, intellectually curious and dedicated people looking to join our remote team. Check us out at www.apollodae.io.

Apollo interns will have the opportunity to advance their skills by making meaningful contributions to product development. Yes, that means your work will be shipped off to production! Aside from this, you will have the opportunity to learn how to trade from veteran traders and even create your own bots.

You’re an enthusiastic student or recent graduate with an interest in back end development. We care more about your desire to learn than your credentials. As an intern, you will support the development team in connecting various APIs, libraries, and creating modules in NodeJS.

These are some of your personality traits:
Reliable and an effective communicator
A strong commitment to quality and deadlines
Motivated by collaboration and love working on a team
Humble and hungry to learn skills within and beyond your domain
Desire for constant self-improvement and excellence
Keen attention to detail

Your expertise comprises the following:
JavaScript application design and testing
Creating Node.js applications
Designing and implementing webhooks and APIs (REST, SOAP, etc.)
JSON, REST, Firebase, Parse, PHP, and the like
Managing back end services and the interchange of data between the server and the users
Asynchronous I/O and NoSQL datastores such as MongoDB
MVC architecture
Unit testing and automation

Bonus points for:
Knowledge of Websockets: deepstream.io, sockjs, socket.io etc.
Experience with golang
Experience with front-end development frameworks like VueJS
Experience working with time-series data (stock market data etc.)

On the job you will:
Write well designed, testable, and efficient code. 
Design, code, and build architecture based on new foundation principles established by the team.
Integrate various APIs, libraries and create modules as needed.
Debug issues and address performance bottlenecks.
Coordinate with product managers to meet functional requirements.
Use time tracking and management tools, such as Toggl and Trello.

We are looking for interns who can start ASAP! Remember, even if you don’t have all of the skills listed above, but are very interested in learning, we’d still love to talk to you! 

To apply, submit the following information to internships@apollodae.io:


Updated LinkedIn profile link (don’t sweat this!) 
What are you studying (or have studied)? (eg. BS Computer Science)
Sample code or repo, if available 
Date you can start working
How long you have been working with Node.js
Details of experience with technologies listed above
Number of hours per week you can fully commit to
Something quirky/interesting about yourself




Upon conclusion of the internship, which shall last no longer than six (6) months or one (1) semester,  but only for those interns with exemplary performance and work ethic may be granted an opportunity to interview with Apollo DAE for a paid position within the company if the company has the proper funding allocations for that department.

Intern understands, acknowledges, and agrees that there will be no compensation for this position.

Intern will be provided a letter of recommendation that is accurate to their position, work ethic, and performance with Apollo DAE. Intern may apply for college credit and Apollo DAE will work with interns applicable school to aid in this objective.

The Celo mission is to build a financial system that creates the conditions for prosperity for everyone.

Celo aims to remove the barriers for large-scale adoption of cryptocurrencies as means-of-payment. Using a novel address-based encryption algorithm, the Celo protocol makes sending money as easy as sending a text. Additionally, Celo uses stable-value tokens pegged to fiat currencies, like the US Dollar, to minimize volatility. Celo is an open protocol enabling many to participate in the system, even with a budget Android smartphone. The first application launching on the Celo platform is a social payments and money transfer app, aimed at developing markets.

We are looking to hire interns for a fully remote, 12 week software development opportunity to assist on our Protocol and Applications Engineering teams. 

About Us:


We are a full-stack company i.e. we are building both blockchain protocols and the user experiences on top of them
We are experienced startup founders and operators
We are highly technical, with backgrounds at places like Google and MIT
We are mission driven with a big goal: to bring sound currency and property rights to those who need it most
We have a strong engineering culture, which values open-source

cLabs ("Celo Labs") started Celo in 2018 and is one of many contributors to the open source project Celo. cLabs builds financial technology to enable prosperity of all beings. 

cLabs is a Teal organization, a method of decentralized management and organizational governance. Roles are defined around the work, not people, and there is a high degree of autonomy. As such, we're all proud to hold the job title of "Partner." For more information on our culture, we encourage you to check out our blog at  https://medium.com/celohq/the-future-is-teal-cc264a5d51d3.

To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)celo.org. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

Background
COVID-19 has hijacked the plans of many, and has the potential to put the global economy on life support. People that should have shuffled off to jobs or internships have had their hopes dashed. But there are plenty of engineers who still want to learn, and we can help.  

Our goal is to teach you how to become as productive as quickly as possible. You’ll learn engineering and big data best practices, and be exposed to business strategies that you wouldn’t get at “bigco” for two more decades. At least. This is an unpaid opportunity, so if you’re looking to maximize your pay, go apply to internship programs at Facebook or Google. If you’re lucky, someone might look at your code one day. 

If you want to write code that will be immediately useful and work with the largest offline data science company that both Google and Facebook turn to for item-level data, then we have opportunities for you. With COVID-19 nothing is a given, but we guarantee that we will further the career of those willing to work, learn, and hustle, whether with our company or elsewhere.

Company Profile
Society is producing increasing volumes of data yet brick and mortar has not kept up with the opportunities. That’s not only troubling for your main street merchant, but also for the multi billion-dollar industries that surround the brick and mortar ecosystem: suppliers, distributors, utility operators, real estate funds, and others. 

WhatsBusy is the offline point of sale (POS) data monopoly. Really. We access petabytes of POS data from tens of thousands of merchants and proprietary data from the card networks (think Visa, Mastercard, AMEX) and are using intelligent, prescriptive analytics built on the back of data science to solve these challenges. From helping merchants better allocate labor to giving Budweiser insights on what promotions to run, we’re providing much needed modernization to an industry (offline commerce) that’s arguably stuck in the middle ages. 
Why You Shouldn’t Apply
You thrive in environments with zero accountability and negligible execution. You like punching the clock from 9-5 and not a minute more. You want to work on “problems” that are already solved and a guaranteed roadmap 10 years out. Titles are important. 

Why You Should Apply
You hate predefined roles based on your age / “experience”. You hate micromanagement. You like building new industries from the ground up. You love learning and being around experts. You are a self-starter. You want to create something important and think too many startups are pointless (how about Uber for mustache combs?). You love data and believe its intelligent application is the future.

About the Role
WhatsBusy is searching for someone who can build and manage front end software products. You must own your work. You will be exposed to marketing, strategy, and business development at senior levels. You must love data, believe in the power of data, and have a natural curiosity to solve real problems with data. You should understand 80/20 and have a visceral aversion to performing the same task twice. The right candidate will question, push back, and know when to run full speed. 

General Responsibilities
Working with development teams to build and iterate products, including issue tracking, Q&A, change management, and issue resolution. Interaction with product management, senior leadership, and partners/customers to build and iterate solutions that drive tangible ROI.

Experience
Development
Comfortable in front end mode
Can optimize performance of systems and code
Can quickly find ways to understand new technologies
Well versed with design best practices
Well versed in UI / UX principles
Well versed in PWA (progressive web apps)

Tech Tools
JQuery, Bootstrap/Sass, HTML5/CSS3, RESTful APIs, Git,

Nice to Haves
Photshop, Figma, ES6

Expected Projects
Billing and trials management products
Customer onboarding optimization
Search interfaces and data visualization
Scheduling interfaces

🧱 Get in on a startup on truly the ground floor. Together, we'll shape the future of the company.

Who we are...

Assured aims to disrupt the insurance industry by modernizing its most archaic component: claims. Currently, 300,000 claims adjusters spend their days talking on the phone and typing into unstructured text fields. We can do better—by combining logic, inference, and modern computer vision tools, we're able to both increase efficiency and improve customer satisfaction. By rearchitecting how the underlying information is ingested and stored, we're poised to impact the core of a trillion dollar industry.

We're two second time founders out of Stanford who care about transforming the world with software. We've built companies from enterprise software to aerospace, and couldn't be more excited about taking on the insurance industry. We are looking for our first intern to work with us as we continue building out our product and deploying it to some of the largest insurance carriers in the world.

Company Description
At Aerovect, we leverage advanced automation to transform logistics and cargo handling at some of the busiest airports and logistics centers in the world. With a focus on bringing self-driving technologies to complex industrial environments, AeroVect is shaping the future of industrial automation, backed by top-tier investors.

If you have a passion for applying autonomous driving technologies to impact the flow of goods for millions of people, we want to talk to you!

Job Description
We’re looking for Engineering interns who are eager to bring autonomous driving systems to life from the ground up. Minimum Internship duration is 2 months, with flexible start and end dates.

In this role, you will help grow our ADS software stack in a fast-paced, early-stage startup environment. You will own and lead the design, simulation, and real-world implementation of a specific autonomy module as part of creating a category-defining ground vehicle system aimed at automating cargo movement at airports and logistics hubs. 

Specifically, we are looking for individuals who have deep functional expertise in one or more of the following areas:


Perception and Sensor Fusion
Localization and Mapping
Vehicle Control, Planning, and Decision Making


Your job scope will involve selecting and working with both cutting-edge techniques as well as proven, off-the-shelf technologies to support your specific ADS module, and working with other members of the engineering team to integrate into the overal system architecture… all while creating unprecedented value and functionality for the modern supply chain. 

The opportunity offers a technical, hands-on team leader the chance to help develop a market-defining enterprise product that combines autonomous vehicle technology with a software-as-a-service (SaaS) business model.

This role will work closely with our co-founders and the Autonomy Lead.

What You’ll Do

Define, lead, and own the hands-on creation of your ADS subsystem module, targeting milestones and working with internal/external partners — expect to spend ~75% of your time performing hands-on development, with the remaining 25% integrating with the overall software stack, working with a team of world-class engineers to target aggressive milestones.

Design, implement, test, and support ADS module functionality through simulations and real-world test runs in context of the airside airport environment, including vehicle corridors and airport apron.

Work with the engineering team at large to support all aspects of ground vehicle autonomy, including planning, perception, navigation, and infrastructure subsystems

Collaborate with hardware engineering to create an integrated system, including calibration and integration

Understand and keep up-to-date with state of the art

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications


Strong CS fundamentals (via academic or industry experience)
Background in developing the autonomy (sensing & decision-making) functions of a deployed, autonomous vehicle
High-performing engineering experience
2+ years experience working on software engineering teams
Comfort with shipping safety-critical software
Experience shipping a working robotics or vehicle autonomy subsystem
Candidates with unconventional experiences especially encouraged
Willingness to get hands-on and have lots of fun


Ideal Qualifications


Advanced research experience in vehicle autonomy or machine learning
Background in safety-critical software/system development (preferably a ground robotics functional safety standard such as ISO 26262 or IEC 61508)
Prior experience developing and supporting all aspects of autonomy for a production ground-vehicle subsystem, or research prototype (end-to-end, full lifecycle development preferred)
Startup experience
Experience with ROS, OpenCV
Experience with Carla, CarSim, Simulink or comparable technologies


Additional Information
AeroVect is a technology company that applies the latest advances in autonomous driving systems to create today the airports and logistics centers of the future. We work with airports around the world to bring self-driving tow tractors to life.

Our experienced team of engineers and aerospace industry specialists from Harvard and MIT have collectively spent decades developing cutting-edge autonomy and aerospace technologies. Founded on the principles of safety, efficiency, and reliability, our mission is to create the airport of the future today, making logistics work for millions of people while having lots of fun on the way. Read more on our website at www.aerovect.com .

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

• Redux for state management
• Node and Express backend
• MongoDB and Mongoose for database

• Production deployment on DigitalOcean (or possibly AWS)

We are looking for bright engineers interested in designing elegant solutions to difficult problems in the autonomy space. Our software engineers work across our suite of products, tackling a variety of full-stack, infrastructure, robotics, and graphics challenges. At Applied, we encourage all engineers to take ownership over technical and product decisions, closely interact with users to collect feedback, and contribute to a thoughtful, dynamic team culture.

At Applied, you will:


Work across our entire stack to develop new products, features, and tools for our customers' autonomy development workflows
Have an unparalleled opportunity to work with domain experts across a variety of fields: infrastructure, robotics, and graphics engineers, as well as startup veterans
Carve out your own area of expertise and influence product decisions
Collaborate with other members in the autonomy ecosystem and learn about different approaches to solving core issues in autonomy


We are looking for someone who:


Is a self-starter and can quickly become comfortable with new technical tools
Designs efficient and effective solutions to a wide range of engineering challenges
Takes initiative in a fast-paced environment


Nice to have:


Working knowledge of frontend, API layer, database ORM, containerization, or cluster orchestration frameworks (such as React, GraphQL, SQLAlchemy, Docker, or Kubernetes)
Experience working with simulation tools, modeling physical problems, or using robotics middlewares (such as ROS)


Autonomy is one of the leading technological advances of this century that will come to impact our lives. The work you’ll do at Applied will meaningfully accelerate the efforts of the top autonomy teams in the world. At Applied, you will have a unique perspective on the development of cutting edge technology while working with major players across the industry and the globe.

location: Los Angeles • North America • San Francisco Bay Area • Remote
description:
We offer year-round internship opportunities

What time of the year do you hire interns and new grads?
We hire year-round and offer flexible 3, 6, 8 and 12-month work terms.

Working at Genity
We’re solving the world’s most important problems, and are looking for talented, driven, and passionate individuals who share our passion to change the world. Our culture is fast-paced, energetic and innovative. We work to build an inclusive environment in which everyone, regardless of gender, race, religion, age, or background, can do their best work.

Why us?
Our year around program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically, personally, and professionally through their experience here. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Genity with projects that are critical to their team’s success.

Instead of going on coffee runs and making copies, you’ll be seated at the table making critical decisions that will influence not only your team, but also the achievement of our mission.  

Required


Currently working towards or a recent graduate of a BS, MS, PhD program in STEM
Kubernetes, Docker, Container Environments
Linux OS Core
Proficient with: GoLang, C/C++


How to apply?
Please specify how much you have of in the requirements list, why you'd like to work with us, and an example of something you've built or worked on that you're proud of. Additionally, a pdf or google doc of your resume should be attached as well.

Hiring Process


Submit Application and Cover Letter
Zoom/Skype/Google Hangout call
Test with one of our engineers over Zoom/Skype/etc...
Meet with members of the team
Hire if the right fit has been found


Do interns and/or co-ops get hired back full time?
Yes. Based on Genity’s current hiring needs and the student’s proven performance.

description:
Hi Right Now is a platform that hosts video speed networking events. This is our MVP but we have a much more ambitious vision to enable humanity to form deep meaningful connections.

Our team has founded advertising and real estate startups and worked at Goldman Sachs, Salesforce, Sofar Sounds, and Deutsche Bank. 

We are offering a 3 month internship for a highly motivated backend engineer who will play a key role in helping us build features on top of our MVP.

The ideal candidate is smart, relentless, and always ready to roll-up your sleeves to learn and solve problems. We're looking for someone who is not afraid to challenge our ideas and add their unique perspective.

Code you write in your first week will be used in production and you'll contribute to our bleeding edge tech stack. 

Upon successful internship, you'll have an opportunity to join us full-time.

Some of the technologies we use:- .NET MVC 4.5 (both for applications and api)- AngularJS, React Native - Elastic Search - Redis- SQL(MsSQL) and NoSQL(CosmosDB) - Git & Github- Selenium and Unit TestingWe're backed by Microsoft Ventures ve Techstars.

We are looking to hire Software Development tech lead interns for managing the product lifecycle and tech interns working on the products we are building for venture capital and private equity markets. It is a great opportunity for people looking to make their careers as a team lead/product manager in product based tech companies.. We understand that the role does not offer much in terms of monetary compensation but is a great way to kickstart your career in product management and full stack software development. It is also a great opportunity to learn product management and state of the art full stack web development skills.

The tech lead should be able to join us at least for 2 months and should be willing to commit 2-3 hours of dedicated development time on a daily basis along with 1-2 hours of project management tasks. You’ll have a chance to push your code to production within a week of joining the team. Interested candidates should include their CV (and past work samples).
Culture
Our team is completely remote with team members based in Japan, India and Canada.  We are a company working in the space of Venture Capital and Private Equity focusing on startups from emerging markets and are (primarily) catered towards Japanese investors and companies (we don’t mind working with global players either)
Tech Stack:
Our tech stack is written in:


ReactJS for Frontend
NodeJS/Flask for backend (depending on which tech product team you join)
Cloud hosted MongoDB for database
Github for issue and project management
AWS (Amazon Web Services) for Deployment

Ideal Candidate
An ideal candidate should have decent knowledge of concepts above and willingness to learn. We value commitment and dedication over past experience. The candidate should be able to manage people reporting to him/her and should be able to take ownership of the tech product they are working on.
Software Development Methodology
We follow lean startup methodology and value iterative development over full-on product development cycles. We incorporate agile methodologies into development (we are not onto the stage for sprint planning YET). We follow continuous integration development style for deploying code. 
About Investocracy:
Investocracy (https://www.investocracy.co/) is one of a kind startup and investment deal discovery platform focused on connecting startups from Africa and other emerging markets and is targeted towards Japanese investors and companies. We also operate a bi-lingual (English and Japanese) news and media platform invc.news catering to global startup information and updates. The company founder is an alumnus from IIT Kanpur, India.

We offer the following services:


Consulting services into raising funding, especially from Japan
Startup incubation service under our umbrella (currently work in progress)
Tech platform to connect founders and investors for pitch practice
Market research and custom made venture capital reports
Startup and Investor Networking Events
News and Media website (https://www.invc.news/) covering exclusive interviews with founders, funding related news, resources for entrepreneurs
Top startup and venture capital lists for a particular domain (example MedTech) in a particular geography  (example: Singapore)


Our purpose is simple: Provide Information Democracy for global investments.

position: Software Engineer - Intern with interest or knowledge in health and AI
description:
Begnosis is a company based on preventing disease before it happens.  Begnosis is doing this through a health algorithm that takes data and computes it based on seven categories to give an individual information on how to prevent disease and become healthier.

We are currently looking for enthusiastic, reliable software engineer interns right now to help us build this algorithm.  

If you have an interest in health, that's a plus.

If you are interested in being a software engineer intern with Begnosis, please email us your resume and why you think you would be a good fit to jason@begnosis.com

U.S. CITIZENSHIP OR GREEN CARD REQUIRED
(Note: This is due to U.S. export regulations, and we are unable to make exceptions.)

Four billion people do not have access to the internet. Astranis is going to change that. We are building the next generation of smaller, lower-cost telecommunications satellites to bring the world online. 

Come work with incredibly smart people who have flown things in space before. No prior space experience needed, you just need to enjoy getting your hands dirty with real hardware and be okay with struggling to do things that seem impossibly hard.

We’re a well-funded team of over 100 world-class engineers that move fast. We raised our Series B ($90M) from Andreessen Horowitz and Venrock, launched our first satellite in 2018, secured our first major customer deal in 2019, and we’ll triple the satellite internet capacity of Alaska in 2021. 

Our mission and our products are meant to connect the world and everyone in it, regardless of gender, race, creed, or any other distinction. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we encourage all people to join our team and bring their unique perspective to help make us stronger.

Role


Design signal processing for custom software defined radio hardware (ex. channelization, equalization, PA linearization, gain control, carrier synchronization, symbol mapping, framing, channel coding/FEC, etc)
Work closely with FPGA developers to implement and test the signal processing on radio hardware
Model the end-to-end radio system from earth to space, and back.
Drive radio architecture trade studies, run link budgets, optimize the radio system for maximum performance for dozens of markets and use cases around the world


Requirements


Bachelor of Science degree in electrical engineering or equivalent
A passion for working in a fast-paced environment and constantly learning
Strong fundamentals in "signals and systems" (basic transforms, filters, aliasing, analysis in both continuous and discrete domains, interpolation, decimation, etc)
Strong fundamentals in digital communications (modulation, coding, synchronization, fading, doppler, multiple access, channel capacity, etc)
Familiar with software development (some experience writing software for DSP, MCU, and/or FPGA, experience in one or more scripting languages)
Familiar with analog concepts (amplifiers, analog filters, gain and delay variation, reflections, compression, etc)
Experience working with signal generator, signal analyzer, network analyzer, oscilloscope, etc
US Citizenship or Green Card


Bonus


Experience with software defined radios
Experience with Python
Experience with GNU Radio
Experience with FPGA development (and/or embedded C)

U.S. CITIZENSHIP OR GREEN CARD REQUIRED
(Note: This is due to U.S. export regulations, and we are unable to make exceptions.)

Four billion people do not have access to the internet. Astranis is going to change that. We are building the next generation of smaller, lower-cost telecommunications satellites to bring the world online. 

Come work with incredibly smart people who have flown things in space before. No prior space experience needed, you just need to enjoy getting your hands dirty with real hardware and be okay with struggling to do things that seem impossibly hard.

We’re a well-funded team of over 100 world-class engineers that move fast. We raised our Series B ($90M) from Andreessen Horowitz and Venrock, launched our first satellite in 2018, secured our first major customer deal in 2019, and we’ll triple the satellite internet capacity of Alaska in 2021. 

Our mission and our products are meant to connect the world and everyone in it, regardless of gender, race, creed, or any other distinction. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we encourage all people to join our team and bring their unique perspective to help make us stronger.

Role


RTL Development for FPGA targeted applications
Work with multiple FPGAs and toolchains
Interface FPGAs with a variety of peripherals including high speed data converters, memories, MCUs
Write software to interface and test RTL in hardware
Collaborate closely with electrical and software engineers


Requirements


US Citizenship or Green Card (This is a legal requirement; no exceptions)
Currently pursuing a B.S. or M.S. in electrical engineering, computer science, computer engineering, or equivalent
A passion for hardware development, including working in a fast-paced environment and hands-on design and development
Experience in designing, implementing, and testing high throughput systems implemented on FPGAs
Proficiency with Verilog/SystemVerilog for synthesis


Bonus


Experience with UVM and advanced SystemVerilog verification
Experience with Xilinx FPGAs
Experience with Vivado IDE, TCL
Familiarity with system level estimates and implications of power, thermal, and real estate
Experience with high speed data converters (ADCs, DACs, JESD204B)
Experience with circuit level debugging
Experience with digital communication theory and implementation, such as LDPC implementations
Experience with space-based systems
Experience with modern communication systems (RF, IF/IQ, time/freq domains, modulation)
Experience in at least 1 domain beyond logic design. This could be DSP/radio design, software, hi-rel design (e.g. fault analysis & recover), etc.

Come work with incredibly smart people who have flown things in space before. No prior space experience needed, you just need to enjoy getting your hands dirty with real hardware and be okay with struggling to do things that seem impossibly hard.

We’re a well-funded team of over 100 world-class engineers that move fast. We raised our Series B ($90M) from Andreessen Horowitz and Venrock, launched our first satellite in 2018, secured our first major customer deal in 2019, and we’ll triple the satellite internet capacity of Alaska in 2021. 

Our mission and our products are meant to connect the world and everyone in it, regardless of gender, race, creed, or any other distinction. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we encourage all people to join our team and bring their unique perspective to help make us stronger.

Role


Work with the GNC & Propulsion team to design, build, and test satellite hardware and software.
Take on an interdisiciplinary role to test propulsion hardware and integrate it into satellites.
Analyze the effects of operating propulsion systems, and develop solutions to mitigate consequences to other spacecraft systems.


Requirements


Currently pursuing a B.S. or M.S. in a technical discipline (e.g. engineering, CS, physics) with a focus on chemical and/or electrical propulsion for spacecraft
Familiarity with spacecraft systems and operation
Demonstrated ability to personally design, build, and test hardware and/or software from scratch
US Citizenship or Green Card


Bonus


Familiarity with spacecraft design
Experience with Python
Test experience with spacecraft propulsion systems
Test experience with electrical hardware

U.S. CITIZENSHIP OR GREEN CARD REQUIRED
(Note: This is due to U.S. export regulations, and we are unable to make exceptions.)

Our mission and our products are meant to connect the world and everyone in it, regardless of gender, race, creed, or any other distinction. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we encourage all people to join our team and bring their unique perspective to help make us stronger.

position: Community-Oriented Full Stack Open Source Developer
description: Joatu is an open source Ruby on Rails community-building platform designed, developed, and maintained by a team of dedicated volunteers. Our platform is designed to help people become engaged and empowered citizens by providing them with opportunities to use their skills to build more resilient communities.We are looking for community-oriented full-stack developers to join our team and help expand our community empowerment platform. The ideal candidate will be able contribute at least 10 hours per month to the project. Previous experience with Ruby on Rails is an asset, but not required. Don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.---Learn more about Joatu:- We are currently applying to become a Benefit Corporation (B-Corp).- Recent winner of the Cooperathon 2017 in the Smart & Inclusive City category.As a user, you can create a local event that brings value to the community. Does that look like a park cleanup? A community garden? An alleyway concert? A puppet show? A potluck for the hungry? It's up to you! And each of these activities generate Community Action Points (CAPS) for their volunteers.With these CAPS, you can exchange them with other members on the platform for their goods and services, and with some local businesses who also want to be supportive of local community actions.We also publicise the freely accessible local spaces like libraries and community centres so that you have places to host your local events more readily.
