Position Overview

As a Software Engineer, Intern, you'll have the opportunity to spend 12 weeks working on one (or more) of the engineering teams at MemSQL. As an intern, you will be at the forefront of real-time technology that’s revolutionizing how companies run their businesses everyday. With release cycles throughout the year, our engineers are accustomed to moving quickly in a rapid production environment. To do this successfully, we work collaboratively and creatively across teams to maximize our opportunity for impact. We also believe it’s important to celebrate our wins together whether it be at local spot or getting out of the city for some exploring.

As a Software Engineer, Intern, you will be empowered to own your projects end-to-end and be an active contributor throughout the product life cycle. To expedite your growth path, you will partner with engineers who deeply care about your success and will lend their expertise to your professional development. Our engineers are not just technical partners/mentors, but are also business partners who are exposed to all areas of the business, working with teams such as product, marketing, and sales.
Role and Responsibilities

Our Software Engineers work on small, collaborative teams to help drive our company forward. Whether you’re building new features in Javascript and React.js, increasing the runtime and performance of a MemSQL cluster, or writing new C++ code for the query optimizer, our University Graduates are responsible for brand new and existing projects that are deployed into production with each release. Your work will include everything from writing to testing software, and you’ll gain a significant understanding of both the product and the business. 
Required Skills and Experience


Enrolled in a B.S. Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related discipline 
Deep understanding of C.S. fundamentals
Strong programming skills with Python, Go, C, C++, or JavaScript
Passionate about building highly reliable software
Firm grasp of algorithms and data structures




MemSQL is The No-Limits Database™ powering modern applications and analytical systems with a cloud-native, scalable architecture for maximum ingest and query performance at the highest concurrency. MemSQL envisions a world where every business can make decisions in real time and every experience is optimized through data. 

Global enterprises use the MemSQL distributed database to easily ingest, process, analyze, and act on data in order to thrive in today’s insight-driven economy. MemSQL is optimized to run on any public cloud or on-premises with commodity hardware. Visit memsql.com or follow us @memsql.

Consistent with our commitment to diversity & inclusion, we value individuals with the ability to work on diverse teams and with a diverse range of people.

To all recruitment agencies: MemSQL does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to MemSQL employees. MemSQL is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with the Company.

position: SEO and Coding Internship_Cross Country Road Trip
description:
A truly once in a lifetime summer internship. From May 16-August 1 author Jordan O'Donnell, his manager, Jake Harris, and eighteen interns will embark on a 10-week cross-country road trip to promote Mr. O'Donnell's forthcoming novel Zoon Garden: The Decline of Nation. The entire trip is employer provided, including one converted school bus, two RV trailers, and fuel. Interns will only be responsible for paying for their food. The team will travel through the majority of America, as well as shoot a documentary of the entire trip. 

Mr. Harris and Mr. O'Donnell are searching for 1 to 2 individuals to support the tour's SEO and coding needs. Applicants should have high-level coding abilities including extensive experience with python, java, ruby and other popular programing languages. Applicants should also possess thorough knowledge of SEO to include Google Analytics, Google Trends and Google Search Console. 

Duties Include:
• Maintaining the author’s website, including optimizing it for visibility and sales. 
• Designing and coding the author’s website for optimal aesthetic appeal. 
• Assisting media interns with social media maintenance and marketing 

Pay: The author is a full-time writer, and as such his livelihood is contingent upon the book’s success and at this time he is only able to offer paid 1% commission. If the tour sells 10,000 copies (roughly $35,000), team payout will unfortunately be minimal, $350 per person. If the tour becomes a massive success and sells 300,000 copies (roughly $1,050,000), team payout will be $10,500, and so on and so forth. Regardless of sale numbers, all interns, in exchange for their work, will receive a free ten-week bus trip around the continental United States, including stops in numerous iconic cities and world-renowned sights.

Find further details at www.jordanodonnellauthor.com
APPLY NOW via Angellist or at www.jordanodonnellauthor.com/internships

description: Our mission is to reduce preventable blindness in as many people as possible. Our focus is blindness caused by diabetes.Over 40% of Americans are diabetic or prediabetic, and diabetes is the leading cause of blindness among working-age adults. A simple annual eye exam can reduce the risk of blindness by 96%. However, two-thirds of patients fall through the system due to the inconvenience and high cost of visiting eye specialists.At the heart of Preventa stands our drive to prevent blindness by solving the problem of access and cost, enabling early, affordable, and reliable disease detection. Our novel and disruptive portable and low-cost retinal imaging device paired with an autonomous AI diagnostic software system can solve all these problems.We are a seed-stage startup based in Silicon Valley. Our team consists of a well-respected ophthalmologist with 15+ years of clinical experience (ex-faculty member at UPenn), an algorithm developer specializing in computer vision and machine learning at MIT, a Ph.D. student at Stanford EE with extensive relevant background, and a former investor and operator in the healthcare space (Stanford GSB MBA).We have secured 3 patents on our core design, received funding from multiple sources, and already have pilot paying clients. description:
This is a 6 month internship. You need to show proof that you can receive academic credit or participate in your university's Co-Op programThe short & sweet summary.
Twine helps companies like Evernote, Birchbox, and DollarShaveClub make smarter people decisions by using predictive analytics and visualizations that replace their clunky HR systems.

We’re a fast-growing SaaS company - growing 30% month-over-month and backed by industry leaders like Adam Grant, founders of billion dollar companies, and Sand Hill Road VCs.

Now we’re looking for software engineering interns who want massive impact and incredible growth opportunities in a rapidly scaling team.

Click here to see what one of last year's interns worked on!
What you’ll be doing.

Learn from excellent engineers a small, highly-collaborative team. You’ll join a world-class team, including engineers with 10+ years of startup experience and advisors who are founders/CTOs of billion-dollar companies.
Drive ambitious technical projects that immediately impact our users. Some upcoming projects: interactive data visualizations (React/D3), API integrations (Python/Airflow), and predictive notifications and alerts (pandas/numpy).
Grow incredibly quickly as our company scales. As an early team member, you’ll have massive ownership and a steep learning curve. You’ll pick up new responsibilities as you grow, and work directly with the founders.

What you’ve done.

You’ve built complex, modern web applications. You’re familiar with modern web technologies through class projects and previous work experiences. You’ve also led at least one significant project or technical initiative.
You’re hungry, ambitious, and excited to grow. Previous interns have learned more in their first week at Twine than in dozens of engineering classes. You learn incredibly quickly and are always looking to take on more challenges and responsibilities.

More about Twine.
Our team: Our CEO, Joseph, spent years immersed in people analytics research and helped found an innovation team at Nike that grew 10X in a year. He’s also an Inc. 30 Under 30 recipient. 

Our technology: Our data ingestion pipeline (Python/Airflow) captures people data from recruiting and HR platforms and uses it to create valuable analytics and insights for our users. Our web application is built in Django and React/Redux, and we use D3 for advanced data visualizations. We use AWS infrastructure, and SaltStack to streamline dev ops, scaling, and deployment.

Our values:


Be intellectually curious and humble. Have an insatiable desire to learn, not to be right. Be a “learn-it-all,” not a know-it-all. Have strong convictions, but listen to and learn from others.
Believe in exceptional outcomes. Believe that ordinary people can do incredible things with the right attitude and will. Be positive, inspiring, and optimistic. (At the same time, acknowledge the demanding work ethic and drive required for success.)
Get it done. Focus on rapid learning and execution, and be willing to roll up your sleeves and contribute any way possible. Be indomitably resourceful, drive through obstacles, and deliver on goals.
Help others be great. Treat your teammates, customers, and partners with respect and kindness. Have positive impact on others in all interactions. 


If the role isn’t an exact fit but you’re interested in learning more (we're hiring across the stack), send us a thoughtful note! jobs@twinelabs.com

AI Foundation is a hybrid for-profit and non-profit working on advancing the science and application of AI-based generation technologies.

Together, we can impact mental health on a global scale, and if you're ready to create groundbreaking technology in Emotion AI, we invite you to apply for our Machine Learning Internship role based in San Francisco where you'll get to build a world-class set of machine learning applications to scale across homes, offices, and commutes globally.

Emotion AI is a complex problem and emotional response is not trivial. In order to build an emotion estimation model, we will need to annotate various signal data. We will need to build supervised and unsupervised models and look at model performance and latency, address issues with bias, and ensure that the datasets are large, diverse, representative, and properly labeled for metadata. For supervised learning, we would want to synthetically augment data for generalization and in semi-supervised learning, apply group level annotations. We will be exploring different deep learning approaches, various architectures to solve different variety of tasks, classification, and regressions.

Together, we can impact mental health on a global scale, and if you're ready to create groundbreaking technology in Emotion AI, we invite you to apply for our SWE internship role based in San Francisco where you'll get to build a world-class set of machine learning applications to scale across homes, offices, and commutes globally.

position: Web Development Intern – Work on new challenges while learning new skills
description:
Who we are.

Part consulting group; part startup accelerator we are a startup of startups.  Our goal is to build a team that can quickly find the valuation of any idea and help bring it to market in an efficient low-cost manner.  This may include software development, UX/UI design, marketing or a number of other skills. Whether it's a client company or an internal idea we have what it takes to make it successful.

We’re looking for a co-founder to join the team and lead a team of senior developers and interns, help with product development and become part of the face of the company.

The ideal candidate is an experienced engineer who is comfortable in both large and small environments. Someone who understands leadership and organizational philosophy and most importantly is still hungry to build companies.  So far it's been a fun idea and we're optimistic about success across multiple areas.

Benefits of working with us:
• Enhance your skillset and knowledge
• Opportunity to learn about many different verticals
• Feel empowered and change things - We value ideas and suggestions
• Work in an inclusive culture where transparency, creativity, accountability and ownership are encouraged
• Freedom to take out-of-the-box approach
• Support and resources to grow into a senior management position
• Flat Organization structure
• Exposure to startup challenges

Who you Are
• People tell you that you have a high attention to detail
• You are a bottom-up thinker, and are wholly unsatisfied with a functional solution that you do not understand
• You write clean, readable, testable and maintainable code
• You love working with other people, and people love working with you

• API development experience, using at least one major server side framework (Django, Rails, Node/Express, etc.)
• Experience using a variety of database technologies (SQL, NoSQL, key-value stores, etc.), and familiar with the tradeoffs and use cases for each

Bonus Skills

• You have solid software engineering fundamentals:
o You understand unit/integration/system testing, and have a practical understanding of when each is necessary
o You have good software design skills, and know how to apply separation of concerns, inversion of control, dependency injection, etc.

description:
Apance is looking for a high energy, frontend Software Engineering Intern to join our team. Apance is building the next generation of creative applications to disrupt the design workflow and help artists create together. Our team is fully remote and spread across the Netherlands, Singapore, and the United States.

About the Internship
You will be able to own your work from the start by providing input on architectural design all the way to deploying code that will directly impact our users. 
You will be joining a small, tight-knit team where you can feel free to voice your thoughts on not only the engineering portions but the business as well. You will be working closely with the CEO/engineering lead and Chief Product and Marketing Officer to implement our roadmap that is essential to the success of the product.

The intern will be provided with their own roadmap of features to develop during the internship. Our stack leverages technologies such as Swift, SwiftUI ,C++, and graphics rendering in Metal.

Compensation
We are a bootstrapped startup still in the early stages so unfortunately our interns will not be paid. However, as we grow and raise funding, the intern will be well positioned for future opportunities at the company. We will also work with you to craft your experience as an intern and provide you with real-world experience that can be added to your portfolio/resume. Our team consists of product managers, developers, and designers that are happy to provide you with the guidance and mentoring you need.

What we’re looking for


Must have C++ experience outside of normal coursework. 
Junior or Senior studying Computer Science or recent Computer Science graduate (Class of 2018/2019)
1 year of experience in iOS development with strong proficiency in Metal
Bonus:
If you are a creative/artist with experience using Photoshop, Illustrator, Procreate, etc.
If you own an iPad + Apple Pencil


Time Commitment
Our internship requires at least 20 hours / week for 2 months. You can own your schedule and work whenever you like.
Short weekly meetings are expected but most of our communications are done through Whatsapp and email.

What You’ll Get:


Develop on new technology such as SwiftUI and Metal with guidance/coaching from the founder
Work with a motivated team looking to disrupt the creative market
We will be able to provide you letters of recommendation based on your contribution to the company
Learn to code in Metal
Metal helps you code real time visuals into apps, it is a similar framework to OpenGL or DirectX.
It is coupled with GPU drivers that execute your code in a highly parallel way.


Learning to code with Metal teaches you how to create powerful, highly parallel programs.
This type of computing is used often in High Frequency Trading or Machine Learning at big tech companies.

Tensorflow for example also uses parallel GPU programs to train AI models.

• Interest and ability to learn CMS such as Wordpress and HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or other technologies as needed.

• Experience communicating and solving technical challenges with a remote team of individual contributors, meeting via Zoom.

• Prior leadership experience with a sports team, academic club, or campus organization.

• Working knowledge of algorithms and data structures.

• Strong communication skills in verbal and written English.

If revolutionizing healthcare excites you, join our growing team and help us achieve our mission to build better software for doctors and patients and improve healthcare for all. DrChrono's Engineering team plays a critical role delivering innovative products from inception to mass adoption.  You’ll be able to learn to build things working closely with product as well as create production quality code.  We have the mind and soul of SaaS startup and you’ll be able to build world class software that delights users and can scale to millions of people. The ideal candidate will be eager in a fluid start-up environment and will bring an energetic, fun and creative approach to their work. 

About the Company
DrChrono was founded and is led by two software engineers, Michael Nusimow and Daniel Kivatinos. Unlike other healthcare companies, our company is built from the ground up to address modern healthcare through technology and innovation.  We believe in open APIs and being part of an open ecosystem.  

We are a YCombinator funded Silicon Valley startup working out of the Chronoplex in Sunnyvale, CA and Hunt Valley, Maryland. Since our inception, we have attracted over 100k physicians, 10 million patients, and have been to the White House to discuss how technology can solve healthcare problems as part of the Obama Administration’s Precision Medicine Initiative . So far we’ve booked 20+ million patient appointments and processed 1.5 billion dollars in medical billing per year.  DrChrono is ranked by INC 500 as one of the fastest growing private companies in America.  We are an official Apple Mobility Partner with our industry leading EHR (Electronic Health Records)  iPad app.

Silicon Valley Business Journal designated DrChrono as one of the fastest growing private companies and was voted the #1 mobile Electronic Health Record 5 years in a row by Black Book Rankings.

We require that our interns work on-site at our Chronoplex in Sunnyvale, CA
This role requires 10-12 hours a week

Domain Knowledge on EHR
Project management 
Product processes
Coding Skills on React.js or Graph QL
How to write production quality code

Prifina is helping individuals get control of their data and provides tools for developers to buils apps on top of user-held data.

*Your Role *

Intern position for a technical documentation writer to create, maintain and improve documentation for Prifina's software, software tools, programs and related working processes, largely in the public domain. 

Your responsibilities will include gathering necessary knowledge content externally and from our team, and writing and organizing the documentation to address questions from internal and external developers and end-users in a clear, concise, and structured manner, without using any jargon.

As an intern documentation writer, you will be responsible for such tasks as writing conceptual overviews and procedures, reading and writing example code, or updating help center queries and FAQs. You are expected to be creative and be able to solve problems independently, have good communication skills and be detail-oriented. Ideal candidates will have a background or deep interest in high-quality documentation with usability in mind.

As an intern documentation writer, you will be working on developer products,  you might have to support APIs through conceptual documentation, detailed developer guides, code samples, API references, and other online materials.

*Responsibilities:
*


Design and organize documentation sets for new APIs and developer products.
Edit, clarify and proofread documents written by others, and coach non-writers on ways to improve their writing skills.
Organizing an archiving system and discoverability.
Labeling, sorting and categorizing documents for ease of use.
Retrieving documents upon request.
Adhering to regulatory requirements.
Working with colleagues to ensure consistency of documentation practice.
Helping others on efficient use of documentation.


*Requirements:
*


Degree in communications or a related field;
Write technical documentation for internal or external developer audiences, such as API reference docs and developer guides.
Attention to detail;
Excellent written communication.

The Basics:

Tanium’s Leadership Enablement team is looking for a full-time intern for a 12 week timeframe. The individual will be reporting to the Head of Leadership and Professional Enablement. This is an opportunity for someone with a passion for organizing, creating processes, and using their analytical skills in the area of corporate learning. The focus of this role is to help build foundations in the Leadership and Professional Enablement function as it is newly being established at Tanium. Some tasks include the management of our training feedback surveys, the clean-up and ongoing management of training session resources, and event calendar management. The ideal candidate will bring flexibility to take on additional duties as assigned, the ability to deal with ambiguity in a growing environment and a high level of organizational skills and detail-orientation.
What you'll do:

Survey Management: Craft new surveys for training offerings, ensuring consistency of data collection across all courses. Set up analysis structure for survey data and establish process and cadence via our shared online folder
Event Calendar Management: Work with HR stakeholders to establish and maintain a leadership enablement event calendar on Intranet
Session Resource Management: Clean up and potentially reorganize any training materials in our shared folder. Partner with HR stakeholders to check on session materials that need to be uploaded into the Intranet. Partner to receive new session handout materials, convert into Tanium-branded materials and establish structure to store in shared folder and add to Intranet as needed
Perform other duties as assigned

We’re looking for someone with:

Education:


BA/BS or equivalent experience

Experience:


Background in psychology, business, or project management
Experience with with creating and maintaining documentation and filing structures
Proficient with Google Suite
Experience with analytics 

Other:


Interest in corporate learning
Organized
Detail oriented
Accurate 
Ability to prioritize, manage, and complete projects with tight deadlines
Proactive, can-do collaborator



About Tanium:

At Tanium, we offer a proven platform for endpoint visibility and control that transforms how the world's largest and most sophisticated organizations manage and secure their computing devices with unparalleled speed and agility. There’s a reason why more than half of the Fortune 100, top retailers and financial institutions, and four branches of the US Armed Forces rely on Tanium.

Our unstoppable spirit, drive to do the right thing and win as a team attitude has earned us the rank of 7th on the Forbes list of “Top 100 Private Companies in Cloud Computing” for 2019 and 10th on FORTUNE’s list of the “100 Best Medium Workplaces.”

At Tanium, we take care of our employees and their communities with things like 5 days of Volunteer Time Off.

position: CV, NLP & ML Engineer Intern (Spring, Summer, Gap Year)
description:
About Us
There are products that customers think are cool at the moment, and then there are products that customers cannot live without because they are so incredibly useful. At Matician, we are building the latter because these are the products worth spending our lives on. We want to build great products to solve real problems.

We believe that sensors and algorithms are finally good enough to reimagine home devices and apply Level 5 autonomy and mobility so that people can save time and energy bypassing repetitive and mundane tasks inside the home.

We're a small team with a singular focus on product that combines technologies such as vision, ML, structure-from-motion, and robotics. Our goal is to ship products that people love.
Job Description
Computer Science/Engineering Student to join our early core team in the process of receiving a BS/BEng or MS/MEng or related discipline.
We’d love to hear from you if:

You are genuinely motivated to help those around you, including users at various levels of experience.
You are passionate about tackling large complex projects and are adaptable to learning outside your normal comfort zones.
You love diagnosing complex technical issues and providing hands-on support for hardware and software solutions.
Your curiosity to learn and grow is inversely proportional to your level of ego.
You are excited to do great work.

Qualifications

Ability to solve problems and identify areas of improvement
Ability to write clean, reliable code that can be easily maintained
Experience with Python, Experience with Tensorflow, PyTorch or Numpy a plus
Experience with working on computer vision, machine learning or NLP problems
Ability to work in a fast-paced, autonomously driven, and demanding start-up atmosphere.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with the HW, SW and Algorithms team to bring product vision to life.
Everything involved in applying an ML model to a production use case
Designing and coding up the neural network architecture, gathering and refining data, training and tuning the model
Deploying it at scale with high throughput and uptime
Analyzing the results in order to continuously update and improve accuracy and speed

position: Embedded & Linux Systems Engineer Intern (Fall, Spring, Summer, Gap Year)
description:
About Us
There are products that customers think are cool in the moment, and then there are products that customers cannot live without because they are so incredibly useful. At Matician, we are building the latter because these are the products worth spending our lives on.

We believe that sensors and algorithms are finally good enough that we can apply level 5 autonomy and mobility in order to reimagine home devices. We want to save people time and energy by circumventing the mundane tasks inside the home. We are building great products to solve real problems and ship them to the people we love. We are a mission-driven and tight-knit group that values learning and curiosity in a high-risk, high reward culture.
We’d love to hear from you if:

You are genuinely motivated to help those around you, including users at various levels of experience.
You are passionate about tackling large complex projects and are adaptable to learning outside your normal comfort zones.
You love diagnosing complex technical issues and providing hands-on support for hardware and software solutions.
Your curiosity to learn and grow is inversely proportional to your level of ego.
You are excited to do great work.

The Opportunity

Develop core device functionality from the ground up.
Work with both EE and software teams to ensure feature feasibility.
Perform root cause analysis of system crashes and hardware failures.
Identify bottlenecks to improve system performance.

SKILLS

Strong experience in multi-threaded C and C++ is a must
Strong familiarity with userspace Linux programming and conventions
Working knowledge of Linux kernel internals
Knowledge of common communication protocols (e.g. USB, RS232, TCP/IP/HTTP)
Experience with microcontrollers is a plus
Familiarity with a systems scripting language, such as Shell or Python

At Play. we are passionate about technology and sports, and we're looking for a bright, hungry, and talented Software Engineer Intern to join our iOS Development team. You will be in on the ground floor of launching an exciting new social media platform for sports fans, where you will have the chance to make huge contributions to the engineering team, while working on the latest in mobile application technology. We eat, breathe, and sleep all things sports, and so should you! If you're looking for an exciting company where you can grow your software development skills while rooting for your favorite team, apply today to become a part of the next top social media platform! Requirements:- 1+ Year of experience building mobile applications- Experience building iOS applications in XCode using Swift- Deep understanding of UIKit- Excellent communication skills and passion for tough technical problems Roles & Responsibilities:- Build smooth, stable, and beautiful products with Swift and the newest iOS APIs- Own features through inception, design feedback, implementation, and launch- Collaborate with Product Designers, Product Managers, Backend Engineers, and Data Engineers

Play. is making it easy to bring sports communities together. With teams at the heart of our decisions, Play. is eliminating the sideline, facilitating partnerships, and providing greater access to athletic information. Together, we are building products and services that help create an athletic system everyone can participate in.

Play. is a properly positioned company to address the shift to remote sports during a time of medical uncertainty. The platform served as a novel way for fans to commemorate the biggest sports events in 2019 and poised to scale in 2020. We’re continuing to grow and are looking for incredible talent that can help us achieve our mission.

Play. is headquartered in Playa Vista, Los Angeles County, California, but will work to accommodate remote roles amidst current conditions.

About The Role

As a software engineer on our Backend team, you will be building and owning certain backend services and infrastructure that power our core athletic products. You will also gain a unique look into how the US sports teams works on the inside and strengthen your athletic-domain knowledge. We strive for a high standard of engineering quality while solving unique scalability challenges. You will have high impact roles at a relatively small company for our user base.

Your Day-to-day Will Involve
Having a dedicated work deck and ability to set infrastructure to be used by the eng team
Hire Engineers to grow team and help products scale
Building, testing, and releasing product-facing features with stringent correctness and scalability requirements; these features could be related to market data, recruiting, or performance.
Designing a solution with other engineers and the ops team to fix a scalability problem and then implement it
Working with our frontend team to fine tune our REST API
Collaborating with our data team to support millions of customers
Contributing to open source projects

Some Things We Consider Critical For This Role
3+ years of software engineering experience
Solid understanding of relational databases and transactions
Familiarity with writing highly concurrent systems
Good intuition for REST API design

Bonus Points
Intimate familiarity of Node.js and/or Javascript

Core Tech Stack
Node.js as the main languages and frameworks of choice
MLab as our primary data store
Heroku as our hosting service
Feeling ready to give 100% to disseminate play to players, coaches, and fans everywhere? We’d love to have you apply, even if you feel unsure about whether you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Play., we’re looking for people invigorated by our mission, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

position: BardoVR Internship: BardoVR - An Interactive & Immersive Platform For Change
description:
BardoVR’s  “AfterDeath” is an interactive, game-based VR simulation of the Tibetan Book of the Dead, which describes the journey consciousness takes from the moment of death until its rebirth in another form.  Using mindful, meditation-based techniques- calm focus, equanimity, compassion - “players” access increasingly higher realms within the game-simulation, as they simultaneously deepen their meditation practice.

Who are we looking for?  We are looking for smart, motivated, and creative people who are passionate about TRANSFORMATIVE TECHNOLOGY to join the BARDOVR. We are looking for people who want to change the world! Do you have an interest in Virtual Reality (VR), Fractal Generation, game design/development, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, psychedelics, or growth hacking? We are looking for you. 

Projects Include:
*Virtual Reality (Vr)  Design And Development
*Game Design And Development
*Procedural Generation In Game Design/Procedural Generation In Vr
*Fractal Technology
*Business Development/Partnership Outreach.
*Growth Hacking & Community Development
*Games For Change
*Serious Games 

What will you get working with BardoVR?


Opportunity - we offer real world experience working in a startup that is improving people’s lives. You will work directly with our management team, technology partners, and wellbeing community .
Access  - to a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world. 
Mentoring - works with you to expand your skillset, add to your domain expertise, and grow your network. 
Training - project management, software tools, and access to Wellbeing products and services. 


A few things to know about this position: 


Position is unpaid. We support CPT and academic credit internships (if your school offers these programs). 
Equity compensation based on performance and long term role at BardoVRavailable.
Requires a minimum ~10 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!).


We believe that BardoVR can become a radical platform for change:  an awe-inspiring gamified tool, grounded in ancient wisdom, that not only benefits meditators but specifically targets gamers and VR experience-seekers who otherwise might never come in contact with these profound teachings.  It is a BIG vision! Are you interested?

position: VR Gaming Platform For Change - Unity VR Programming Intern
description:
Interested in Virtual Reality (VR), VR Gaming and Games For Change? We are looking for you! BardoVR’s “AfterDeath” is an interactive, game-based VR simulation of the Tibetan Book of the Dead, which describes the journey consciousness takes from the moment of death until its rebirth in another form.  Using mindful, meditation-based techniques (calm focus, equanimity, compassion) - “players” access increasingly higher realms within the game-simulation, as they simultaneously deepen their mindfulness/meditation practice.

*We are an early stage startup with lots of  VR hats to wear. *


Unity VR programmer:Intern able to code/program in Unity for additions/revisions to our existing AfterDeath VR demo.
LA-based - preferred. Virtual internship - Ok.**


We are looking for candidates that are interested in Transformative Technology, Virtual Reality (VR), Fractal Generation, game design/development, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, psychedelics, or growth hacking.

Visionary Product: Be part of the team that is building an awe-inspiring gamified tool that changes lives.

References/Recommendation

Thanks.

Ben Simon-Thomas
Co-Founder/Executive Producer BardoVR

BardoVR team:
Tom Seidman - Writer/Director. Dartmouth College, American Film Institute (Directing Fellow). DGA Assistant Director for Robert Redford, Clint Eastwood, Peter Weir.  Independent filmmaker.  Meditiator/student of Buddhism for over 25 yrs.
Ben Simon-Thomas - Executive Producer. Buddhist-leaning entrepreneur and ecosystem developer.  Founded startups in the 3D space (SoundFit: 3D Scanning & ODMS: parts-on-demand), social commerce (GroupGain), worked in health-care startups and life style modification businesses (PMRI). MA in Buddhist psychology, degrees in Religious Philosophy and Language.
Grant Anderson - VR Producer.  Former Executive Director at Sony’s 3D Center working with filmmakers including Baz Luhrmann, Ridley Scott, Ang Lee. CGI work on Academy Award-winning teams for Titanic, Spider-Man. Former Studio Head, Jaunt VR. Recently produced location-based VR experience of the Marvel Universe for Disney.

location: Atlanta • New York City • Washington DC • Remote
description:
Software Engineering Intern
Buffalo, NY or Remote

As a software engineering intern at GRASPIE™, you will be an essential member of the team responsible for helping rebuild a web and mobile platform and change the way businesses onboard, train and engage their employees.

Responsibilities

• Help design and rebuild a web and mobile platform from the ground up
• Work closely with key stakeholders to develop features for our web and mobile products
• Be an essential member of the engineering team to proactively identify and address opportunities to improve our culture and technology

Requirements

• Strong understanding of JavaScript
• Experience with ReactJS (or other frontend frameworks)
• Familiarity with NodeJS
• Experience with SQL (Postgres, MySQL)
• Experience working with APIs
• Experience working with Git version control
• Ability to learn new languages and technologies

Nice to have

• Experience with TypeScript
• Experience with GraphQL
• Currently enrolled in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or similar fields

If you think you have what it takes, email your resume to work@graspie.com with “Software Engineering Intern” in the subject line.

About Us

GRASPIE™, an official Y Combinator Startup School and Google for Startups™ Cohort 4 graduate and an early stage venture-backed startup, is a next-gen mobile-first onboard, training and engagement platform for the new connected workforce that allows employers to onboard and train employees faster and at a reduced cost while leveraging dynamic content, custom integrations, and our secret recipe. We have set our sights out to change the way businesses onboard, train and engage their employees. With Covid-19 changing the landscape of hiring and also millennials set to make up more that 75% of the workforce by 2030, training needs to change and the time for GRASPIE™ is NOW!

Engineering Intern (Summer 2021)

Roblox is ushering in the next generation of entertainment, allowing people to imagine, create, and play together in immersive, user-generated worlds. We’re the one and only fastest-growing entertainment platform that lets anyone teach themselves how to code, publish, and monetize any experience imaginable—across any device—reaching over 100 million players across the globe every month! 

The impact that you can have at Roblox is powerful. We’re looking for someone who’s eager to take on a meaningful role in the success of Roblox on a massive scale. Someone who takes play seriously, but also isn’t afraid to have some fun either. Someone who’s ready to take Roblox—and their career—to the next level.

In 2020, we were honored to be one of the Top 100 Internship Programs in the US. In 2019, we were honored to be recognized as a Certified Great Place to Work®. We’ve fostered a company culture that empowers people to do the most defining work of their career in an environment that’s made up of the most passionate, team-oriented, visionary, crazy-smart people you’ll ever meet. Join the Roblox team where play rules and the possibilities are endless.

Work with the most passionate, team-oriented, visionary, and crazy-smart people you’ll ever meet. The engineers at Roblox are working on the hardest problems in tech today -- distributed systems, real time communication, 3D co-experience, massive data processing, social networking, rendering, physics, and more.  As an Engineering Intern, you will have real ownership and impact across one or more of these domains. 

You Are:


Pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or similar technical degree or you are a veteran with years of experience developing Roblox games and are familiar with software engineering from school, internships, personal projects, or previous jobs
Adaptable and able to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
Working towards mastery of one or more programming languages such as Go, Node.js, Ruby, Python, C++, Lua, Swift, C# or Java.
Eager to Learn industry-leading frameworks and libraries.
Passionate about games, community driven content generation, and social networking.
Tenacious about learning and creating great experiences as you work hard with your team to reach collective goals.


You Will:


Be embedded into a software engineering team with responsibility and deliverables
Regularly ship code to production
Own a summer internship project and present it to Roblox leadership
Work collaboratively with Roblox’s design, product, data, QA, and DevOps teams.
Gain valuable and marketable experience helping to build one of the fastest growing software platforms in Silicon Valley

position: Remote, Part-Time Webflow Developer + Designer Intern for Podcast Ad Analytics Platforms for E-commerce Brands.
description:
Interested in building something from the ground up? *Lopa is a new, unique platform developed to help DTC & E-commerce brands optimize their podcast advertising performance and unluck incremental customers. *

By combining automatically transcribed ad reads, complex sentiment/tone analysis, AB testing, and ad read best practices, Lopa focuses on harnessing e-commerce brands' ad reads and increasing conversion rates to streamline customer incrementality. 

As a Webflow developer and designer, you are vitally important to the design and functionality of our website, Lopa. This individual is focused on the overall look of the user interface and know exactly how the program is laid out. This role is most concerned with the flow of the technology, ensuring that there are no stumbling blocks. This person strives for perfection and understands continuous improvement processes.

You have the option of doing this manually, or learning Webflow to streamline the process. While this is an unpaid summer internship we are looking to make full time offers in the Fall.

 Webflow site design and implementation
 Work with team of designers to match brand and value propositions Lopa has to offer.
 Work with executive team and client base to build site to fit client needs

 Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science or related field
 Strong proficiency in JavaScript
 Strong proficiency or williness to learn Webflow

 Attention to quality through unit tests, automation scripts, and code reviews
 Knowledge of object-oriented design principles, design patterns and software architectures

 Ability to analyze data alternate solutions, and risks that use that knowledge to solve problems is essential
 Ability to communicate effectively and work with a variety of people.

 Experience in Squarespace, Shopify, Webflow, Wix, Wordpress, etc
 Strong understanding of the JQuery library.
 Experience working with git.


Before applying, please checkout Lopa so you have context on what it does: https://www.meetlopa.com

KnowBe4 is searching for a Courseware Intern to streamline and improve their courseware content. In addition, this role will be tasked with replacing outdated courses (such as landing pages, courses, assessments, games, and more) built with older technology and converting them into HTML5.

While the ideal candidate needs to understand reasonable software security practices, you do not need to have a background in information security or even in-depth knowledge of HTML; just be ready to learn, detailed oriented, and tech-savvy! Apply HTML, JavaScript and CSS in online learning
Learn how to use distributed version-control system for tracking changes in source code
Learn about translation of assets for the web in a global company

Build portfolio of web assets developed for external customers such as phishing landing pages, online videos, and supporting materials
Hone your web design skills for marketing and online content creation

Training on HTML5, JavaScript, and JSON for creating of online learning/marketing materials at a high level

Strong verbal and written communications
Web development coursework or experience (HTML/CSS)
Excellent time management and organization skills
Attention to detail
Interest in HTML5/JavaScript web design and technologies
An eye for detail in reviewing online materials

Currently enrolled as a Junior or Senior at a college or university pursuing a Bachelor’s degree i.e. Graphic design, marketing, web design, computer programing or related field.

location: Boston • New York City • Washington DC • Remote
description:
Us: A lean-startup-devotee, data-geeky, digital-nomadic, passionate group of city-lovers with a mission to (use data to) make places better and thereby make people happier, healthier, and thrive! More here: www.stateofplace.co

You: An empathetic, I'll-try-anything-once, consummate-people-lover, hustler-at-heart, customer-focused, independent, eager-to-learn, outbound-marketing-enthusiast, who is looking to get a taste of the startup rollercoaster, willing to roll with the punches in the juggernaut of a space that is B2G (and Enterprise) sales, ready to assist with managing our lead pipeline, and want to love life while working with a dynamic group of just plain-good people working to make the world (at least slightly) better! 

The Skinny: State of Place can be traced back to 2003, when our Founder/CEO, Mariela, accidently became a data-geek while creating a tool to objectively measure the built environment characteristics that impact the way people feel about their cities. She soon embraced this new-found title, and began her consulting company, realizing that quantifying what made for good urban design - and calculating its tangible value - was actually the key to convincing people to make cities better (and thereby improve people's lives). Fast forward 13 years later, five years after first offering State of Place as a consulting product, we were awarded a grant from the National Science Foundation's Small Business Innovation Research program that funded the MVP (first saleable version) of our software. One year later, we have worked with 15 customers and counting and have an exciting (yet somewhat) untamed, ever-growing list of prospects. 

Here's where you come in -- the combination of our Founder's internationally renowned reputation and our uber-aggressive inbound campaigns make it relatively easy to attract leads and interest. Now we just need help qualifying and managing those leads. We're also focusing more and more on exciting outbound marketing strategies and sales and are looking for someone to assist our Sales Manager implement this new system to prioritize, track, follow-up - and yes, close - deals more quickly and effectively in a way that is repeatable and (eventually) scalable. 

What you get: This is an unpaid internship, but there is the opportunity for this to transition into a full-time, paid position depending on our close-rate and/or whether we secure outside funding (which we are currently seeking). Clearly, you'll get a ton of on-the-job training (you'd be mentored by our Founder/CEO and our Sales Manager), enjoy flexible working hours, and gain invaluable experience working with an innovative, fast-paced startup. 

State of Place was launched in 2016 with the support of a Small Business Innovation Research grant from the National Science Foundation, a highly competitive program. We successfully completed the 2017 Mass Challenge Accelerator program (only 8% out of 1500+ startups were chosen) and the Kickstart Accelerator Smart Cities program in Zurich (where only 2% of applicants were accepted) as well as the Katapult Accelerator Impact Program in Oslo which provided us with investment capital (where again, only 2% of applicants were chosen)! So you'll also get access to amazing mentors we amassed through these programs and have the opportunity to be part of our ongoing, bootcamp-style deep dive into our customer acquisition! 

Duration:
15-40 hours per week; min. 4 month commitment

Location:
Remote (work anywhere with internet access) but preference for those based in Boston, New York City, Washington DC, or Metro Detroit.

We are Moneyballing City-making. Join us in disrupting the urban planning and real estate industries - replacing the top-down, opinion-based, expert-driven approach accessible to a few with a data-driven, evidence-based one, accessible to the many!

We hope you're as stoked as we are to meet you/us! Attach your resume/CV with a cover letter in your Angel List application. If you have any questions, shoot them over to careers@stateofplace.co. 

Keep on hustling, 
Mariela

You: An empathetic, eager-to-learn, data-driven/research/product development enthusiast, who is looking to get a taste of the startup rollercoaster, ready to assist us in our software and product development efforts to help us scale the business using AI/visual machine learning/data analytics. description: Position Summary: We are looking for an enthusiastic software QA engineer to help us update the product documentation and improve the performance and usability of our mobile app and web-based subscription for brands and retailers. This position is both a technical product management position and a QA engineer position.We are looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) engineer to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality.QA engineer responsibilities include designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect campaign workflows and collaboration opportunities with matchmaking brands to creatives.)The QA technician role plays an important part in our company’s product development process. identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet quality standards.Responsibilities- Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback- Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases- Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities- Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools- Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs- Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved- Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needs- Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements- Monitor debugging process results- Investigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to implement solutions- Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts- Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategiesRequirements- Proven work experience in software development- Proven work experience in software quality assurance- Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes- Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases- Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing- Hands-on experience with automated testing tools- Solid knowledge of SQL and scripting- Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process- Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus- Pursuing BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related Specifically, we are looking for someone who has experience working with PHP stacks (PHP myadmin, JavaScript, HTML, CSS), knowledge of and experience with Third-Party API's and RESTFUL programming principles is not a prerequisite but is definitely a plus. Aside from being technically sound, we are looking for someone who is also passionate about building things and who understands and wants to be a part of what we're trying to accomplish here. One thing we can guarantee you is that this will be unlike any other internship out there, in that we throw our interns into the "deep end" of the pool right away as we hit the ground running with projects that are both fun and challenging. We like to consider ourselves an "idea-centric" company so as much as we appreciate talent and ability we place as much (if not more) value on passion and the ability to bring new ideas and perspective to the table. Best of Luck.

Needless to say that like any other position for which we hire, we need the best of the best! We need full-stack developers competent in JavaScript, Solidity, Python, PHP and more.  Amalgam is preparing for its latest token offering and we're looking to fill this role immediately. You will work closely with the CEO and CTO while building out several of our software solutions, from a P2P Payment Platform, to a Supply Chain Management software, to a proprietary Web Browser and more. We're looking for full stack devs who are capable of front end and back end. 

UI/UX design skills are a plus.

Needless to say that like any other position for which we hire, we need the best of the best! We need backend developers competent in JavaScript, Solidity, Python, PHP and more.  Amalgam is preparing for its latest token offering and we're looking to fill this role immediately. You will work closely with the CEO and CTO while building out several of our software solutions, from a P2P Payment Platform, to a Supply Chain Management software, to a proprietary Web Browser and more. 

UX architecture design skills are a plus, but not required

Needless to say that like any other position for which we hire, we need the best of the best! We need front end developers competent in JavaScript, Solidity, Python, PHP and more.  Amalgam is preparing for its latest token offering and we're looking to fill this role immediately. You will work closely with the CEO and CTO while building out several of our software solutions, from a P2P Payment Platform, to a Supply Chain Management software, to a proprietary Web Browser and more. 

UI design skills are a plus.

The Problem
At its core, education has a fundamental data problem: schools run on legacy infrastructure that's impossible for developers to build on top of. We're on a mission to replace the terrible things that engineers have to do to build classroom software (think nightly CSV FTP transfers) with an API that feels more like Facebook's or Stripe's. On the school-facing side, we're looking to become a single place where schools can discover, integrate, and evaluate the dozens of in-class applications they're using.

When we started seven years ago, four schools used Clever. Today, Clever is used by over 78,000 schools, making it the fastest-growing company in education. We're looking for talented engineers who want to help us build Clever into something every school, student, and teacher relies on.
A Day in the Life
Interns at Clever work alongside full-time engineers, improving existing products and creating apps that live on top of Clever. Our very first intern wrote an iPhone app on the Clever platform that spread to over a thousand schools on the day it was released. Another intern wrote an app that let schools provision Google accounts, which now manages over 2 million student and teacher accounts. 

Clever is mostly written in Typescript, Javascript, Node.js, and Go.

This is exclusively a summer 2021 (May - August / June - September) opportunity. 
Requirements

Must be graduating in or before June 2022. Why is this? Clever only offers internships to college students who will be graduating within 9 months of their internship’s completion because we view internships as a path to a full-time offer. The internship program lets us identify and mentor future engineers, while offering the the intern a chance to see what it's like to be part of the Clever team.  At the end of the internship, we hope to be able to build on a great summer by extending our interns an offer to come back and join us!
Relevant coursework in computer science.
Past projects demonstrating strong coding ability.
A desire to grow as an engineer through collaboration, code reviews, and learning new languages/technologies.
Excellent communication skills
A desire to work in a diverse, highly collaborative team environment

We have various technical roles available within engineering (frontend and backend), integrations, devops, and data analytics. Experience with Javascript, Swift, iOS, Node.JS, Branch.io is helpful. Flexible hours and remote is a possibility. Potential to turn into full time hire.

**W3LL The Wellbeing Exploration And Discovery Marketplace. 
Connecting you with effective, evidence-based solutions that improve wellbeing!

Interested in W3LL Marketplace delivers a dynamic user experience that connects you with tools and resources to improve your wellbeing. We are a WELLBEING marketplace connecting our community (individuals/organizations) with businesses providing wellbeing products and services. W3LL marketplace offers assessment tools, AI based recommendation engine, community reviews of products and services, and easy to understand resources on the science of wellbeing (aka “why does it work”). We are looking for you!

During these “covid” times, we are focusing on four areas that we call miniW3LLs:
*** MiniW3LL: Music/Sound - "The Healing Power of Sound & Music". 
*** MiniW3LL: Teen Wellbeing Resources** - "Being Well During Covid19: Self Care Resources For Teens And Parents Of Teens". 
*** MiniW3LL: VR + Gaming + Mental Health** - “A New Frontier in Transformative Technology”
*** MiniW3LL/SilverW3LL: Senior Wellbeing Resources** -  "Being Well During Covid19: Self Care Resources For Seniors".

We are an early stage startup with lots of hats to wear. W3LL seeks a social media/growth hacking intern to support the following:


Promote WELLBEING thur community engagement initiatives: sharing critical resources that improves wellbeing. 
Webinar: Support/Create/Ideate “MiniW3LL” webinars with thought leaders (startups/scientists/academics/influencers/therapists/investors).
Social Media: Create/support/analyze social media campaigns to support MiniW3LL. 
We are looking for people that have a passion for social media, social networking, and community development in the area of wellbeing and wellness! 
Marketplace Creation: Create unique listings for each MiniW3LL that includes product/service, “science of why it works”, and reviews in a bold and compelling format/UX. 
Share on W3LL website and social channels (FB, Instagram, LinkedIn, SnapChat, TikTok, Reddit, +++). 
LA/Berkeley based - preferred. Virtual internship - Ok.


We are looking for candidates that are interested in Transformative Technology, wellness/wellbeing, health, Machine Learning, AI, Data Visualization, Data Analytics, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, or growth hacking.

Opportunity: Experience working with emerging Transformative Technologies.

Access: W3LL is working with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.

References/Recommendation

Our Company Sezzle is a cutting-edge fintech company whose mission is to financially empower young consumers. Only one in three millennials own a credit card, and the vast majority of millennials possess a subprime credit score or no score at all. To address these problems, Sezzle has built a payment platform that increases purchasing power for consumers by offering interest-free installment plans at online stores. This increase in purchasing power for consumers leads to increased sales and basket sizes for the thousands of eCommerce merchants that currently work with Sezzle.

Fyusion is a machine learning & computer vision company that enables anyone to capture and display interactive 3D 360 images using their smartphone. Our unique 3D format allows for significant additional functionality that 2D images can’t offer, including: background image effects & automatic damage detection for cars, and an understanding of the human skeleton for tagging products & features in fashion E-commerce. Our investors and customers include large international conglomerates and industry leaders, which puts us in a unique and advantageous position. We have ambitious goals and are looking for new energetic team members to help us reach them together.

The Computer Vision team at Fyusion develops and applies state of the art algorithms in visualization, 3D reconstruction, SLAM, bundle adjustment, state estimation, and sensor fusion. We combine this with the efforts from our Machine Learning team to deliver an intelligent product which is loved by our customers. 
We are looking for candidates who are excited about solving complex problems at the intersection of classical 3D geometry and Deep Learning. You will have the resources and opportunities to publish your work at major conferences.

Experience with OpenCV/3D geometry/SLAM/bundle adjustment
Proficient in C++

Over the next 10 years, biotech will fundamentally rewrite the way we live. Gene editing and cell therapy will dramatically change how we treat cancer and other major illnesses. Biofuels and biomaterials will transform the cars we drive, the clothes we wear, and the makeup of everyday objects. Crop science and synthetic biology will produce sustainable and ethical food. Benchling’s mission is to accelerate the research that propels us towards this future, and magnify its impact, through modern software.

Every day, scientists around the world use Benchling in their efforts to solve humanity's most pressing problems. For these scientists, Benchling is the central technology they use to conduct their research.

Benchling was founded by a team of MIT graduates and has raised funding from Benchmark, Andreessen Horowitz, Thrive Capital, and Y Combinator. Our customers include pharmaceutical giants, leading biotechs, and the world's most renowned research institutes.

We're looking for interns to join our Summer 2021 intern class. As an intern, you'll be entrusted with a significant degree of ownership to work alongside full-time engineers who hail from MIT, Google, Facebook, Stripe, and more. Our past interns have built DNA search engines, key pieces of AWS infrastructure, and analytics pipelines. You'll learn how a startup works and how to build high quality software, quickly.

RESPONSIBILITIES


Work with and learn from a strong team of engineers hailing from MIT, CMU, Facebook, Stripe, and more. We grow our interns through mentorship and ownership.
Own projects end-to-end, from initial design, to prototype, to large-scale rollout.
Design and implement backend models and API endpoints for complex scientific workflows.
Design and implement rich frontend components and architecture. We build and operate one of the largest, richest React applications out there and power complex scientific analyses.


YOU


Are pursuing a BA/BS and/or MA/MS degree in computer science, math or a related technical field.
Have had a prior Software Engineer Internship or similar experience. 
Build software with a product-first approach. You ship code quickly and care about the real world impact of your code.
Have strong abilities in problem solving and iterating on feedback.
Enjoy ownership and building key pieces of product.
Are interested in learning more about life science (prior knowledge is not required; desire to learn is a must).


YOU MIGHT WORK ON

Check out our blog post for some examples of past intern work. Here are some other examples of recent and future projects:


Tools to simulate DNA assembly - computers can assist scientists by informing scientific decisions with complex calculations. Our bulk assembly tool allows scientists to simulate constructing hundreds of DNA constructs in parallel, visualizing the end result and highlighting potential issues.
Complex querying and visualization tools - The big advantage of keeping all your data stored in one system is that you can query that data all at once, without digging up multiple sources. This works best when you can query Benchling the same way you can query a database: by choosing from a large number of possible filters on any related objects, joining together various sources, and performing aggregations. We want to enable this in a user-friendly experience, without leaving your browser.
A customizable computation platform - Biologics are typically large protein complexes composed of a number of shared parts. We want to let scientists specify computations that can aggregate data across all of these related entities to surface derived values, which can be used in everything from data analysis to naming schemes. Scientists may develop custom protein analysis algorithms or proprietary validation logic - they'll be able to hook in custom code and push that computation to Benchling.
Data warehouse as a product - customers can click a button and spin up a fully-managed, query-able warehouse with all their Benchling data in one place. Customers get the full power of Redshift/Postgres without having to manage ETL pipelines or tune Postgres configuration values.
A new permissions system - Our existing permission system relies on Read/Write/Admin access that can only be applied at the top level of the file hierarchy. To roll out to enterprises with 500+ users, we need to offer them fine-grained control around exactly what actions a user can take and let them manage these in a hierarchical fashion.


OUR VALUES


Empower through information. We explain the “why” behind every decision, unless there are highly sensitive circumstances. We're honest about how we're doing, especially in difficult times. We believe that sharing information builds trust and enables better decision-making.
Rely on tenacity. Hard work is one of the greatest factors to determine success and is fully under our control. We must make the most of every day by bringing the highest level of determination. Dreaming big is not enough.
Raise the bar. Pushing ourselves and others to improve will be uncomfortable and at times result in failure. However, it's critical to our success. We're dedicated to creating a place where everyone feels challenged to improve.
Build a lever. We choose to build tools and infrastructure that will help others make world-changing innovations. There's less glory in it, but in the words of Archimedes, "Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world."


PERKS AND BENEFITS


Work with a talented yet humble team
Competitive compensation & equity package
401k
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Monthly health & wellness stipend
Weekly virtual social events, and annual company retreats
*$1,000 work-from-home stipend


In following best practices and safety protocols, all Benchling employees are expected to work remotely until we are further advised that it is safe for employees to resume work in their respective office locations.   

*To support remote work conditions, Benchling provides each employee a one-time stipend of $1,000 upon commencing employment, and additional discounted employee purchase plans for home-office equipment.

position: Internship in Windows Application Development (Remote & Unpaid)
description:
If you are looking to be a pioneer in creation of a seamless behavior of devices for its users, an opportunity to be part of an implementation of a new windows app from scratch to deployment, then come help us launch HuTouch.

HuTouch is part of an early stage startup in its concept phase. HuTouch is Dropbox for your activities, i.e., it will allow users to pick up their activities (apps, data, pointers) from where they stopped when they move between devices. Our 1st launch will help users move their activities seamlessly between Windows 10 PCs and Android smartphones, and vice versa.

With 30 early adopters willfully awaiting a raw prototype, HuTouch needs a windows application developer intern (specifically for UWP) to help accomplish the below goals & tasks (priority as stated):


Research and development to identify solutions for functionalities designed by our early adopters. You will be required to have problem solving skills, study different materials and come up with solutions for  functionalities within HuTouch that are not developed yet. This may take up 40% to 50% of your time on this project.
Deliver code & User Experience not just with high quality but also with a logical flow in mind. The tasks associated to this job requirement is coding and unit testing, where the intern will need to make sure no critical or high defects creep into the developed code. This may take 30% to 40% of your time on this project. 
Demo of individual features developed and end to end flow. It'll be required for you to present the working app to the founder over a call while you screen share. There is no need for powerpoint presentations here, as this will be a pure demo of the app. This will take up 10% to 20% of your time on this project. 
Understand the flow within HuTouch and apply it to design frameworks for HuTouch. An intern will be asked to read about HuTouch, the platform (UWP) to think like an architect and identify any foreseeable risks during implementation. This will take up the remaining time on this project.


Visit www.HuTouch.com for more details & to see the demo video on our patent pending concept on continuity.

Skills required:


Average to expert coding skills in UWP & Win32 platforms for windows 10
Client side coding to interact with APIs for AWS or cloud solutions
Problem solving skills that drives the urge to solve by looking at a problem from different angles/scenarios and presenting with multiple solutions.
Communication skills to articulate the problem and clarify assumptions
Self reliant to move the project forward

position: Internship to develop UI/UX for HuTouch (Remote & Unpaid)
description:
If you are looking to be a pioneer in creation of a seamless and logical user behavior for device/app users then come help us launch HuTouch.

HuTouch is part of an early stage startup in its concept phase. HuTouch is Dropbox for your activities, i.e., it will allow users to pick up their activities (apps, data, pointers) from where they stopped when they move between devices. 

We are proud to say we have a working prototype available for our early adopters. However, HuTouch needs an intern to take it from a prototype to release ready for the masses, which requires ground up UX research and UI. The below goals or tasks (priority as stated) are part of this internship:


Understand the vision to implement a simplistic or logical user experience
Conduct all of UX research tasks - primary/secondary research, user interviews, output in terms of tested recommendations
Journey maps, final flows that address the value ads of HuTouch 
Develop style sheets, wireframes, low fidelity screens
Work hand in hand with the product manager for developing the functionalities or improving on prototype


Visit www.HuTouch.com for more details & to see the demo video on our patent pending concept on continuity.

Average to expert skills in UI & UX for apps with device user in mind
Use of tools for UX research and UI
Problem solving skills that drives the urge to solve by looking at a problem from different angles/scenarios and presenting with multiple options.
Communication skills to articulate the problem and clarify assumptions
Self reliant to move the project forward

Do you believe that creators should have the ability to get paid for the value they give to their fans?
We do, which is why we're building Patreon, a platform that powers membership services for creators with established followings. Patreon strives to provide creators with insight, education, and tools that make it possible to retain creative control while running their creative business, so creators can focus on creating and energizing their fanbases.

Our user base has doubled in the last year alone, and we have paid over $1 billion directly to creators on our platform. Bringing Patreon to creators and patrons all over the world is essential to achieving our mission. In order to support this growth, we are looking for Software Engineering Interns.
What you will do:

Collaborate with other engineers and internal stakeholders to develop new functionality required for our product strategy.
Collaborate with the broader engineering organization to improve overall product quality, including web app performance, test coverage, accessibility standards, and best practice code patterns.
Participate in the product development lifecycle which encompasses product discovery and delivery.
Work with an assigned mentor dedicated to your successful onboarding and learning experience throughout your 12-week internship
Work with people from all walks of life.

Skills and experience you possess:

Prior software engineering experience from internships, hackathons, or other side projects
Experience working with JavaScript, React, Webpack, AWS, and Python 3.6
Experience building web apps full-stack, integrating with relevant APIs and services
Familiarity with relational databases
Familiarity with CI/CD practices 

What you will be able to accomplish:

Gain experience in agile development practices, including sprint planning, retros, and demos.
Gain experience in technical collaboration on a shared codebase
Gain experience on doing good code reviews
Gain experience shipping production-ready code
Learn testing best practices
Learn accessibility standards
Learn best practice code patterns

Who you'll work with:
At Patreon, you'll join a high-performing and highly-empathetic team of people who proudly work on fulfilling our mission of funding the creative class. Our culture of creator-first, thoughtful teammates keeps work creative, stretching, and rewarding.
Our Core Behaviors:

Put Creators First. Patreon is nothing without our creators. 
Achieve Ambitious Outcomes. Set, measure, and accomplish goals that deliver massive value to our creators and patrons. 
Cultivate Inclusion. We want an environment that retains and engages the diverse teams we build.
Bias Towards Action. When in doubt, we take the next best step, then course correct when needed. We go out of our way to fix problems when we see them. We take ownership seriously.
Be Candid and Kind. Be extremely caring and extremely direct in all you do at Patreon, especially when it comes to giving positive and constructive feedback. 
Be Curious. You don’t know it all, and that’s the fun part. Everything gets better when you’re curious. Things get more interesting, more clear, and more approachable. When you bring curiosity into the workplace, you’re growing yourself, your teammates, and Patreon as a whole.

Want to learn more about Patreon?

Check out our reviews on Glassdoor
Check to see if you know a Patreon teammate on LinkedIn

Team Description

Metanoea team is working to revolutionize the finance industry by streamlining the process of digitization. Metanoea is pioneering a fundamentally new paradigm in the B2C and B2B sectors. We are passionate about building awesome products for the financial sectors that are both enterprise-facing and consumer-facing. Metanoea team is working towards disrupting the fintech, enterprise, and personal finance space by leveraging AI and machine learning to transform traditional financial systems.

Job Responsibilities:

In addition to being an excellent TypeScript or JavaScript developer, you are proficient with at least one No-SQL or SQL database (like DynamoDB) and have experience developing solutions using a number of AWS products like Amplify, Lambda, Cognito, SES, SNS, SQS, S3, etc. You have developed and supported RESTful APIs. You have strong problem solving and debugging skills that extend to the client-side, network, and beyond.

Ideally, have experience designing and developing GraphQL APIs, you are familiar with continuous integration and deployment (CI & CD) practices, and test-driven development (TDD).

And ideally, you have a good grasp of basic technical architecture design and, in particular, you understand how to construct solutions using the facilities of the AWS cloud. You are able to manage trade-offs with respect to robustness, simplicity, scalability, and speed of development.

Duties and Responsibilities
• Analyze stories and other requirements and design the technical implementation including data models, API definitions, and code
• Develop TypeScript code to implement GraphQL APIs
• Develop unit and functional tests where required
• Deploy and test your solutions in the AWS cloud
• Support other developers as they integrate and test your solutions
• Document technical and business processes

Required Skills:
• Software development experience, including 1 or more years of server-side TypeScript or JavaScript development
• Experience developing solutions with AWS (Lambda or EC2 based)
• Experience with database APIs for No-SQL and SQL databases
• Degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent (Diploma in Programming with relevant experience)
• Effective and concise written communication

We incorporate factors including genetics, symptom profiles, desired drug properties, concomitant medications, comorbidities, family history, medical history, lifestyle factors, among others in this analysis. This analysis enables doctors to prescribe the safest and most effective medications for their patients and is currently being used in clinics across the country. This position is focused on front-end development.

position: Full Stack Engineering Intern (SDE) - UNPAID - Remote/WFH
description:
We have several intern positions open. Please apply to the one that excites you the most. This post is for the Full Stack Engineering Intern (SDE)   open to both undergrads as well as graduate interns. This is a remote UNPAID position.

The summer program would require a minimum of 10 weeks of committment. 

You would work in teams of other interns to build new products/tools that are in the works. You would be placed in a squad that would comprise of teams of engineers, designers, business and product roles and you would be able to build from scratch new tools/products and launch them before completing your internship.

Please share your git profile if you have one, or any other way you can showcase your past work.

We use Django/postgres/AWS. More at https://builtwith.com/?https%3a%2f%2fwww.attendancebot.com. We would be flexible on the front end framework you want to use.

You would some flexibility to pick up projects that you like most and you will get a chance to deliver several 2-3 week long projects to get a breadth of experience.
